An attacker can exploit this issue to execute arbitrary code in the context of the application using the ActiveX control (typically Internet Explorer). Failed attacks will likely cause denial-of-service conditions.

name: Aurigma Image Uploader ActiveX Controls 'ExtractIptc/ExtractExif' Buffer Overflow
description: Aurigma Image Uploader ActiveX controls are prone to multiple buffer-overflow vulnerabilities because they fail to perform adequate boundary checks on user-supplied data. Successfully exploiting these issues allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code. Failed exploit attempts will result in denial-of-service conditions.

name: Windows Vista Adobe Acrobat 9 Denial of Service
description: Adobe Acrobat 9 is prone to a remote denial-of-service vulnerability when supplied with a malformed URL. This issue can allow remote attackers to crash the application denying further service to legitimate users.

name: Peachtree Accounting 'PAWWeb11.ocx' ActiveX Control Insecure Method Vulnerability
description: The Peachtree Accounting 'PAWWeb11.ocx' ActiveX control is prone to an insecure-method vulnerability. Successfully exploiting this issue allows remote attackers to launch arbitrary applications with the privileges of the application running the ActiveX control (typically Internet Explorer).

name: F-PROT Antivirus Infinite Loop DoS
description: The scanning engine in F-Prot Antivirus allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (infinite loop) via a malformed ZIP archive, probably related to invalid offsets.

name: Apple QuickTime Panorama Sample Atoms Movie File Handling Buffer Overflow
description: There exists a buffer overflow vulnerability in Apple QuickTime. The flaw is due to boundary errors in the QuickTime Virtual Reality (QTVR) when processing QTVR movie files. A remote attacker can exploit this vulnerability by enticing the target user to open a crafted QTVR movie file. Successful exploitation may lead to arbitrary code execution in the security context of the logged in user.

name: Microsoft Windows Image Acquisition Logger ActiveX Control Arbitrary File Overwrite Vulnerability
description: Microsoft Windows Image Acquisition Logger ActiveX control is prone to a vulnerability that lets attackers overwrite files with arbitrary, attacker-controlled content. The issue occurs because the control fails to sanitize user-supplied input. An attacker can exploit this issue to overwrite files with attacker-supplied data, which will aid in further attacks.

name: Macrovision InstallShield Update Service Agent ActiveX Memory Corruption
description: The InstallShield Update Service Agent ActiveX control in isusweb.dll allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (memory corruption and browser crash) and possibly execute arbitrary code via a call to ExecuteRemote with a URL that results in a 404 error response.

name: Apple QuickTime SMIL qtnext Redirect File Execution
description: Apple QuickTime before 7.5 allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary programs via crafted protocol handlers.

name: Mozilla Firefox Directory Traversal Vulnerability
description: Some vulnerabilities have been reported in Mozilla Firefox, which can be exploited by malicious people to bypass certain security restrictions, to disclose sensitive information, or to potentially compromise a user's system.

name: Mozilla Firefox XSLT Remote Code Execution
description: Mozilla Firefox allow remote attackers to create documents that lack script-handling objects, and execute arbitrary code with chrome privileges, via vectors related to (1) the document.loadBindingDocument function and (2) XSLT.

name: Microsoft SQL Server 2000 Client Components ActiveX Control Buffer Overflow
description: Buffer overflow in the SQLVDIRLib.SQLVDirControl ActiveX control in Tools\Binn\sqlvdir.dll in Microsoft SQL Server 2000 (aka SQL Server 8.0) allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (browser crash) or possibly execute arbitrary code via a long URL in the second argument to the Connect method.  NOTE: this issue might only be exploitable in limited browser configurations.

name: Microsoft Windows GDI+ VML Buffer Overrun Vulnerability
description: A remote code execution vulnerability exists in the way that GDI+ handles gradient sizes. The vulnerability could allow remote code execution if a user browses to a Web site that contains specially crafted content. An attacker who successfully exploited this vulnerability could take complete control of an affected system.

name: WinFTP Server (NLST) Denial of Service
description: WinFTP Server has a vulnerability which leads to Denial of Service attack. An attacker can exploit by this by sending crafted packets

name: Mozilla Firefox User Interface Null Pointer Dereference DoS
description: Mozilla Firefox is prone to a remote denial-of-service vulnerability. Successful exploits can allow attackers to crash the affected browser, resulting in denial-of-service conditions.

name: JComSoft 'AniGIF.ocx' ReadGIF And ReadGIF2 Methods ActiveX Buffer Overflow
description: JComSoft Animation GIF ActiveX control is prone to multiple buffer-overflow vulnerabilities because the application fails to perform adequate boundary checks on user-supplied data. Successfully exploiting these issues may allow remote attackers to execute arbitrary code in the context of the application using the ActiveX control. Failed exploit attempts will likely result in denial-of-service conditions.

name: Yahoo! Toolbar Helper Class ActiveX Control Remote Buffer Overflow Denial Of Service
description: Yahoo Toolbar ActiveX Control is prone to a buffer-overflow vulnerability. An attacker can exploit this issue to trigger denial of service conditions in Internet Explorer or other applications that use the vulnerable ActiveX control

name: Microsoft Windows Media Services 'nskey.dll' ActiveX Control Remote Buffer Overflow
description: Microsoft Windows Media Services ActiveX control is prone to a buffer overflow vulnerability because it fails to perform adequate boundary checks on user supplied input. An attacker can exploit this issue to execute arbitrary code in the context of an application using the affected ActiveX control(typically Internet Explorer). Failed attacks will likely result in denial of service conditions.

name: Novell iPrint Client nipplib.dll ActiveX Control IppCreateServerRef Buffer Overflow
description: There exist stack and heap buffer overflow vulnerabilities in Novell iPrint client library nipplib.dll. A remote attacker could exploit these vulnerabilities via a web page that passes the large crafted argument to vulnerable ActiveX control methods. In order to exploit the vulnerability, the attacker needs to entice the target user to visit the malicious web page. Successful exploitation would cause buffer overflow that may allow for arbitrary code execution in the security context of the currently logged on user.

name: Novell ZENworks Desktop Management ActiveX Control 'CanUninstall()' Buffer Overflow
description: Novell ZENworks Desktop Management ActiveX control is prone to a buffer-overflow vulnerability because the application fails to adequately check boundaries on user-supplied input. An attacker can exploit this issue to execute arbitrary code in the context of the application using the ActiveX control.

name: VMware ESX / ESXi openwsman HTTP Basic Authentication Buffer Overflow
description: Multiple buffer overflows in Openwsman 1.2.0 and 2.0.0 allow remote attackers to execute arbitrary code via a crafted "Authorization: Basic" HTTP header.

name: VBA32 Personal Antivirus Malformed Archive DoS
description: VBA32 (VirusBlokAda) Personal suffers from a denial of service vulnerability that causes memory corruption and causing the software to crash while scanning a malformed archive.

name: GdPicture Pro 'gdpicture4s.ocx' ActiveX Control Arbitrary File Overwrite Vulnerability
description: An ActiveX control in GdPicture Pro SDK is prone to a vulnerability that lets attackers overwrite files with arbitrary, attacker-controlled content. The issue occurs because the control fails to sanitize user-supplied input. Successful exploits may compromise affected computers and could aid in further attacks.

name: Autodesk Multiple Products LiveUpdate ActiveX Control Code Execution
description: There exists a code execution vulnerability in Autodesk LiveUpdate ActiveX Control shipped with multiple products. A remote attacker could exploit the vulnerability by enticing the target user to open a malicious HTML document. Successful exploitation would cause arbitrary command execution in the security context of the currently logged on user.

name: Apple QuickTime Panorama PDAT Atom Parsing Buffer Overflow
description:
Stack-based buffer overflow in Apple QuickTime before 7.5.5 allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code or cause a denial of service (application crash) via a QuickTime Virtual Reality (QTVR) movie file with crafted elements in panorama track PDAT atoms.

This vulnerability was shared with Third Brigade in advance of public disclosure by TippingPoint through its Zero Day Initiative. (http://www.zerodayinitiative.com)

name: Novell eDirectory dhost.exe Accept Language Header Heap Overflow
description:
An unspecified error exists in the processing of HTTP Accept-Language headers, which can lead to arbitrary code execution under the context of the SYSTEM user.

This vulnerability was shared with Third Brigade in advance of public disclosure by TippingPoint through its Zero Day Initiative. (http://www.zerodayinitiative.com)

name: Mozilla Firefox MathML Integer Overflow DoS
description: Two errors in the image rendering implementation of Firefox layout engine are exploited to cause a crash.

name: Red Hat Directory Server Accept-Language HTTP Header Parsing Buffer Overflow
description: Multiple buffer overflows in the adminutil library in CGI applications in Red Hat Directory Server 7.1 before SP7 allow remote attackers to cause a denial of service (daemon crash) or possibly execute arbitrary code via a crafted Accept-Language HTTP header.

name: Apple QuickTime RTSP URL Handler Buffer Overflow
description: Buffer overflow in Apple QuickTime 7.1.3 allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code via a long rtsp:// URI.

name: Apple QuickTime/iTunes QuickTime Type Remote Buffer Overflow Vulnerability
description: Apple QuickTime is prone to a buffer-overflow vulnerability.An attacker can exploit this issue by enticing an unsuspecting user to open a specially crafted file.Successfully exploiting this issue allows remote attackers to cause the affected application to crash. Given the nature of this issue, attackers may also be able to run arbitrary code, but this has not been confirmed.

name: Microsoft Windows GDI (.ico File) Remote Division By Zero Vulnerability
description: GDIPLUS fails to handle exceptional condition when opening malicious .ico files. This results in a remote explorer crash (via IE), and a constant loop crash if the ico file is located on the desktop

name: Apple QuickTime RTSP URL Buffer Overflow
description: Buffer overflow in Apple QuickTime 7.1.3 allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code via a long rtsp:// URI.

name: Microsoft Excel File Format Parsing Vulnerability
description: A remote code execution vulnerability exists in Microsoft Excel as a result of improper memory allocation when loading Excel objects. The vulnerability could allow remote code execution if a user opens a specially crafted Excel file that includes a malformed object. An attacker who successfully exploited this vulnerability could take complete control of an affected system.

name: Microsoft Internet Explorer Cross-Domain Information Disclosure
description: An information disclosure vulnerability exists in Internet Explorer that could allow script to gain access to a browser window in another domain or Internet Explorer zone. An attacker could exploit the vulnerability by constructing a specially crafted Web page that could allow information disclosure if a user viewed the Web page.

name: Microsoft Internet Explorer Event Handling Cross-Domain Vulnerability
description: A remote code execution or information disclosure vulnerability exists in Internet Explorer that could allow script to gain access to a browser window in another domain or Internet Explorer zone. An attacker could exploit the vulnerability by constructing a specially crafted Web page that could allow remote code execution or information disclosure, depending on the operating system, if a user viewed the Web page.

name: Microsoft Internet Explorer HTML Element Cross-Domain Vulnerability
description: A remote code execution or information disclosure vulnerability exists in Internet Explorer that could allow script to gain access to a browser window in another domain or Internet Explorer zone. An attacker could exploit the vulnerability by constructing a specially crafted Web page that could allow remote code execution or information disclosure, depending on the operating system, if a user viewed the Web page.

name: Microsoft Internet Explorer HTML Objects Memory Corruption Remote Code Execution
description: A remote code execution vulnerability exists in Internet Explorer due to attempts to access uninitialized memory in certain situations. An attacker could exploit the vulnerability by constructing a specially crafted Web page. When a user views the Web page, the vulnerability could allow remote code execution. An attacker who successfully exploited this vulnerability could gain the same user rights as the logged-on user.

name: Microsoft Internet Explorer Uninitialized Memory Corruption Remote Code Execution
description: A remote code execution vulnerability exists in the way Internet Explorer accesses an object that has not been correctly initialized or that has been deleted. An attacker could exploit the vulnerability by constructing a specially crafted Web page. When a user views the Web page, the vulnerability could allow remote code execution. An attacker who successfully exploited this vulnerability could gain the same user rights as the logged-on user.

name: Detect Office 2007 Files On HTTP Stream
description: Detects office 2007 files being requested over http.

name: Port Mapper Decoder DNS RPC Service
Sun Solaris RPC Metad PortMapper Decoding
description: When a client wishes to make an RPC call to an RPC application, it will first contact portmapper service on the server machine to determine the port number where RPC packets should be sent.This filter decodes the Unix port mapper traffic on port 111 to find out the ports those services are running on and configures firewall/IPS rules to use those ports

name: Sun Solaris RPC Ypupdated PortMapper Decoding
description: When a client wishes to make an RPC call to an RPC application, it will first contact portmapper service on the server machine to determine the port number where RPC packets should be sent.This filter decodes the Unix port mapper traffic on port 111 to find out the ports those services are running on and configures firewall/IPS rules to use those ports

name: Adobe Flash Player Clipboard Security Weakness
description: The System.setClipboard method in Adobe Flash Player allows remote attackers to populate the clipboard with a URL that is difficult to delete, as exploited in the wild in August 2008.

name: Mozilla Firefox Mouse Drag Weakness
description: Mozilla Firefox allows user-assisted remote attackers to move a window during a mouse click, and possibly force a file download or unspecified other drag-and-drop action, via a crafted onmousedown action that calls window.moveBy.

name: Youngzsoft CMailServer CMailCOM ActiveX Control Buffer Overflow
description: CMailServer is prone to multiple buffer-overflow vulnerabilities. Successfully exploiting these issues allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code in the context of the application. This facilitates a remote compromise of affected computers.

name: Iseemedia LPViewer ActiveX Control Multiple Buffer Overflows
description: Multiple stack-based buffer overflows in MGI Software LPViewer ActiveX control (LPControl.dll), as acquired by Roxio and iseemedia, allow remote attackers to execute arbitrary code via the (1) url, (2) toolbar, and (3) enableZoomPastMax methods.

name: Port Mapper Decoder Message Queuing Service
Hummingbird HostExplorer ActiveX Control 'PlainTextPassword()' Buffer Overflow
description: Hummingbird HostExplorer ActiveX control is prone to a buffer-overflow vulnerability because the application fails to adequately check boundaries on user-supplied input. An attacker can exploit this issue to execute arbitrary code in the context of the application using the ActiveX control. Failed attacks will likely cause denial-of-service conditions.

name: Youngzsoft CCProxy CONNECT Request Buffer Overflow
description: There exists a buffer overflow vulnerability in Youngzsoft CCProxy. The flaw is due to improper processing of the CONNECT request sent to the server. Remote attackers could exploit this vulnerability by sending CONNECT requests with specially crafted parameter. Successful exploitation would allow for arbitrary code injection and execution with the privileges of the server process.

name: IBiz E-Banking Integrator ActiveX Control 'WriteOFXDataFile()' Insecure Method Vulnerability
description: An IBiz E-Banking Integrator ActiveX control is prone to a vulnerability that allows attackers to create or overwrite arbitrary data with the privileges of the application using the control (typically Internet Explorer). Successful exploits can compromise affected computers or cause denial-of-service conditions.

name: Chilkat XML ActiveX Control Multiple Vulnerabilities
description: The Chilkat XML ActiveX control is prone to multiple vulnerabilities. An attacker can exploit these issues by enticing an unsuspecting victim to view a malicious HTML page. Successfully exploiting these issues will allow the attacker to create or overwrite arbitrary files on the victim's computer in the context of the vulnerable application using the ActiveX control (typically Internet Explorer).

name: Oracle Database Server 'CREATE ANY DIRECTORY' Privilege Escalation Vulnerability
description: Oracle Database Server is prone to a privilege-escalation issue related to the 'CREATE ANY DIRECTORY' user privilege. Attackers may exploit this issue to gain full SYSDBA privileges on the vulnerable database server.

name: Microsoft Windows Explorer Unspecified .ZIP File Denial of Service
description: There exists a vulnerability in Microsoft Windows Explorer which allows user-assisted attackers to cause a denial of service (application crash) via a crafted .ZIP file.

name: Trend Micro OfficeScan 'cgiRecvFile.exe' Buffer Overflow
description: Trend Micro OfficeScan is prone to a buffer-overflow vulnerability because the application fails to properly bounds-check user-supplied data before copying it into an insufficiently sized memory buffer.

name: Shutdown TNS Listener Via Oracle Reports Servlet
description: Unspecified vulnerability in the Oracle Reports Developer component in Oracle Application Server and E-Business Suite, allows remote authenticated users to affect availability via unknown vectors.

name: CA ARCserve Backup Tape Engine Denial Of Service
description: There exists a denial of service vulnerability in CA BrightStor ARCserve Backup Tape Engine service. The vulnerability is due to insufficient input validation in the ClientCreateJobHandle library function. A remote unauthenticated attacker may exploit this vulnerability by sending a crafted message to the target server. Successful attack could cause a denial of service condition for the TapeEng and MediaSrv services.

name: Mozilla Firefox Layout Engine Remote Code Execution
description: A memory corruption vulnerability is reported in the layout engine of Mozilla Firefox which could potentially causes a crash when weird characters are added into input. The vulnerability only affects Firefox 3.

name: DB Software Laboratory 'VImpX.ocx' ActiveX Control File Corruption
description: DB Software Laboratory 'VImpX.ocx' ActiveX control is prone to multiple vulnerabilities that let attackers delete or overwrite arbitrary files on the affected computer in the context of the application using the ActiveX control. Successful attacks can result in denial-of-service conditions.

name: VLC Media Player TY File Stack Based Buffer Overflow
description: There exists a stack based buffer overflow in VLC Media Player while accessing malformed MPG files.

name: DATAC Control RealWin SCADA System Crafted Packet Handling Buffer Overflow
description: There exists a  stack buffer overflow vulnerability in DATAC Control RealWin SCADA System server product. The vulnerability is due to a boundary error while parsing a crafted value in a FC_INFOTAG/SET_CONTROL packet. Remote unauthenticated attackers could exploit this vulnerability by sending a malicious packet to the target server and can execute arbitrary code with the privileges of the affected service, which normally is Administrator privilege on the affected system.

name: ICQ Toolbar 'toolbaru.dll' ActiveX Control Remote Denial Of Service
description: ICQ Toolbar 'toolbaru.dll' ActiveX control is prone to a denial-of-service vulnerability.An attacker can exploit this issue to trigger denial-of-service conditions in Internet Explorer or other applications that use the vulnerable ActiveX control.

name: Microsoft PicturePusher ActiveX Cross Site File Upload Attack
description: There is a vulnerability in Internet Explorer. Changing dll settings allows attackers to build highly customized POST requests against private  upload facilities, using the browser as a proxy to bounce them and by injecting  a filename sub-field through ex. the AddString() method. Using this attackers can gain access.

name: LogMeIn 'RACtrl.dll' ActiveX Control Multiple Remote Denial of Service
description: LogMeIn 'RACtrl.dll' ActiveX control is prone to multiple denial-of-service vulnerabilities.A successful attack allows a remote attacker to crash the application, denying further service to legitimate users.

name: MW6 ActiveX Insecure Method Vulnerability
description: There is a vulnerability in MW6 software. when attackers send crafted packets, he can gain access.

name: Mozilla Firefox Cross Site Scripting Attack
description: Mozilla Firefox before 2.0.0.17 and 3.x before 3.0.2. and certain versions of Thunderbird and SeaMonkey allow remote attackers to bypass cross-site scripting (XSS) protection mechanisms and conduct XSS attacks via byte order mark (BOM) characters that are removed from JavaScript code before execution, aka "Stripped BOM characters bug."

name: Aurigma Image Uploader ActiveX Control Remote Stack Buffer Overflow
description: Aurigma Image Uploader ActiveX control is prone to multiple stack-based buffer-overflow vulnerabilities because it fails to perform adequate boundary checks on user-supplied data. Successfully exploiting these issues allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code in the context of the application using the ActiveX control (typically Internet Explorer). Failed exploit attempts likely result in denial-of-service conditions.

name: VLC Media Player TY File Stack Based Buffer Overflow Vulnerability
description:
VLC media player is prone to a stack based buffer overflow vulnerability because the application fails to perform adequate boundary checks on user
supplied input. Attackers may leverage this issue to execute arbitrary code in the context of the application. Failed attacks will cause denial of service conditions.

name: C6 Messenger Installation URL Downloader ActiveX Control Arbitrary File Download
description: C6 Messenger Installation URL Downloader ActiveX control is prone to a vulnerability that lets remote attackers download files from arbitrary locations to an affected computer. Attackers may exploit this issue by enticing victims into visiting a maliciously crafted web page.

name: Sun Solaris "sadmind" Buffer Overflow Vulnerability
description: Stack-based buffer overflow in the adm_build_path function in sadmind in Sun Solstice AdminSuite on Solaris 8 and 9 allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code via a crafted request.

name: Microsoft DebugDiag 'CrashHangExt.dll' ActiveX Control Remote Denial of Service
description: Microsoft DebugDiag 'CrashHangExt.dll' ActiveX control is prone to a denial-of-service vulnerability because of a NULL-pointer dereference error. A successful attack allows a remote attacker to crash the application using the ActiveX control, denying further service to legitimate users.

name: Visagesoft eXPert PDF Viewer ActiveX Control Arbitrary File Overwrite Vulnerability
description: Visagesoft eXPert PDF Viewer ActiveX control is prone to a vulnerability that lets attackers overwrite files with arbitrary, attacker-controlled content. Successfully exploiting this issue will allow an attacker to corrupt and overwrite arbitrary files on the victim's computer in the context of the vulnerable application using the ActiveX control.

name: Mozilla Firefox JavaScript Engine Remote Code Execution
description: Multiple unspecified vulnerabilities in Mozilla Firefox, allow remote attackers to cause a denial of service (memory corruption and application crash) or possibly execute arbitrary code via vectors related to the JavaScript engine.

name: Hummingbird Deployment Wizard 10 'DeployRun.dll' ActiveX Control Multiple Security Vulnerabilities
description: Hummingbird Deployment Wizard 10 ActiveX control is prone to multiple vulnerabilities that attackers can exploit to run arbitrary code. The issues stem from insecure methods used within 'DeployRun.dll'. An attacker can exploit these issues by enticing an unsuspecting victim to visit a malicious HTML page. Successfully exploiting these issues allows remote attackers to edit registry key information or execute arbitrary code in the context of the application using the ActiveX control (typically Internet Explorer). Failed exploit attempts will likely result in denial-of-service conditions.

name: Microsoft Print Spooler Service Could Allow Remote Code Execution
description: A remote code execution vulnerability exists in the printer spooler service that allows an attacker who successfully exploited this vulnerability to take complete control of the affected system.

name: Dart Communications PowerTCP FTP for ActiveX 'DartFtp.dll' Control Buffer Overflow
description: PowerTCP FTP for ActiveX is prone to a buffer-overflow vulnerability because the application fails to adequately check boundaries on user-supplied input. An attacker can exploit this issue to execute arbitrary code in the context of the application using the ActiveX control. Failed attacks will likely cause denial-of-service conditions.

name: Solaris PortBind XDR-DECODE taddr2uaddr() Remote DoS
description: The RPC subsystem in Sun Solaris allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (daemon crash) via a crafted request to procedure 8, related to the XDR_DECODE operation and the taddr2uaddr function.

name: Microsoft Internet Explorer Window Location Property Cross-Domain Vulnerability
description: A remote code execution or information disclosure vulnerability exists in Internet Explorer that could allow an attacker to again access to a browser window in another domain or Internet Explorer Zone. The vulnerability could be exploited by clicking a specially crafted web page.

name: xine-lib 'sdpplin_parse()' Remote Buffer Overflow
description: Array index error in the sdpplin_parse function in input/libreal/sdpplin.c in xine-lib allows remote RTSP servers to execute arbitrary code via a large streamid SDP parameter.

name: CA ARCserve Backup DB Engine Denial Of Service
description: Unspecified vulnerability in the database engine service in asdbapi.dll in CA ARCserve Backup (formerly BrightStor ARCserve Backup) r11.1 through r12.0 allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (crash) via a crafted request, related to "insufficient validation."

name: Mozilla Firefox UTF-8 URL Handling Stack Buffer Overflow
description: Some vulnerabilities have been reported in Mozilla Firefox, which can be exploited by malicious people to bypass certain security restrictions, to disclose sensitive information, or to potentially compromise a user's system.

name: Block Incoming Proxy Queries
description: This filter protects non proxy servers by dropping all incoming proxy queries. Attackers could probe for open HTTP proxy service by sending simple proxy queries. Only apply this filter to servers that do not provide authorized proxy service.

name: Persits Software XUpload ActiveX Control Remote Buffer Overflow
description: XUpload is prone to a buffer-overflow vulnerability because it fails to perform adequate boundary checks on user-supplied input. An attacker may exploit this issue to execute arbitrary code in the context of an application using the ActiveX control (typically Internet Explorer). Failed attacks will likely cause denial-of-service conditions.

name: VMware Server ISAPI Extension Remote Denial Of Service
description: An unspecified ISAPI extension in VMware Server before 1.0.7 build 108231 allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (IIS crash) via a malformed request.

name: Multiple Vendor FTP Server Long Command Handling Security Vulnerability
description: ftpd in OpenBSD 4.3, FreeBSD 7.0, and NetBSD 4.0 interprets long commands from an FTP client as multiple commands, which allows remote attackers to conduct cross-site request forgery (CSRF) attacks and execute arbitrary FTP commands

name: VLC Media Player .RT Stack Buffer Overflow
description: VLC will open the file .rt automatically with a video of the same name, which leads to Stack Buffer Overflow

name: MSXML Header Request Vulnerability
description: An information disclosure vulnerability exists in the way that Microsoft XML Core Services handles transfer-encoding headers. The vulnerability could allow information disclosure if a user browses a Web site that contains specially crafted content or opens specially crafted HTML e-mail. An attacker who successfully exploited this vulnerability could read data from a Web page in another domain in Internet Explorer.

name: Mozilla Firefox Graphics Rendering Remote Code Execution
description: Mozilla Firefox reported crashes in graphics rendering which could potentially cause memory corruption. The vulnerability only affects Firefox 3.

name: Chilkat HTTP 'ChilkatHttp.dll' ActiveX Control Insecure Method Vulnerability
description: Chilkat HTTP ActiveX Control is prone to multiple vulnerabilities that allow attackers to overwrite arbitrary files. These issues affect multiple CLSIDs associated with the control. An attacker can exploit these issues by enticing an unsuspecting victim to view a malicious HTML page. Successfully exploiting these issues will allow the attacker to corrupt and overwrite arbitrary files on the victim's computer in the context of the vulnerable application using the ActiveX control.

name: NMS DVD Burning SDK 'NMSDVDX.dll' ActiveX Control Arbitrary File Overwrite Vulnerability
description: An ActiveX control in NMS DVD Burning SDK is prone to a vulnerability that lets attackers overwrite files with arbitrary, attacker-controlled content. The issue occurs because the control fails to sanitize user-supplied input. Successful exploits will compromise affected computers and will aid in further attacks.

name: DjVu 'DjVu_ActiveX_MSOffice.dll' ActiveX Component Heap Buffer Overflow
description: The DjVu ActiveX control is prone to a heap buffer-overflow vulnerability because it fails to properly bounds-check user-supplied data before copying it into an insufficiently sized memory buffer. An attacker can exploit this issue to execute arbitrary code within the context of the affected application. Failed exploit attempts will result in denial-of-service conditions.

name: MSXML DTD Cross-Domain Scripting Vulnerability
description: An information disclosure vulnerability exists in the way that Microsoft XML Core Services handles error checks for external document type definitions (DTDs). The vulnerability could allow information disclosure if a user browses a Web site that contains specially crafted content or opens specially crafted HTML e-mail. An attacker who successfully exploited this vulnerability could read data from a Web page in another domain in Internet Explorer.

name: Microsoft Windows MSXML DTD Cross-Domain Scripting Vulnerability
description: An information disclosure vulnerability exists in the way that Microsoft XML Core Services handles error checks for external document type definitions (DTDs). MSXML versions prior to v6 allow parameter entities in external DTDs to reference data on a different domain, which can then be accessed.

name: Trend Micro OfficeScan CGI Parsing Buffer Overflow
description: Stack-based buffer overflow in CGI programs in the server in Trend Micro OfficeScan allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code via an HTTP POST request containing crafted form data, related to "parsing CGI requests."

name: Microsoft Windows Srvsvc Memory Allocation Denial of Service
description: There exists a denial of service vulnerability in the Microsoft Windows Server service (srvsvc). A remote attacker can trigger this flaw by sending crafted RPC requests to the problematic service. This may potentially result in the affected service allocating extensive amounts of memory and processor resources, leading to a denial of service condition.

name: Chilkat Crypt ActiveX Control 'ChilkatCrypt2.dll' Arbitrary File Overwrite Vulnerability
description: Chilkat Crypt ActiveX control is prone to a vulnerability that let attackers overwrite files with arbitrary, attacker-controlled content. Successful exploits will compromise affected computers and will aid in further attacks.

name: mIRC PRIVMSG Message Processing Buffer Overflow
description: Stack-based buffer overflow in mIRC 6.34 allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code via a long hostname in a PRIVMSG message.

name: Microsoft Internet Explorer '&NBSP;' Address Bar URI Spoofing
description: Internet Explorer is affected by a URI-spoofing vulnerability because it fails to adequately handle specific combinations of the non-breaking space character ('&NBSP;'). An attacker may leverage this issue to spoof the source URI of a site presented to an unsuspecting user. This may lead to a false sense of trust because the user may be presented with a source URI of a trusted site while interacting with the attacker's malicious site.

name: Apple CUPS SGI Image Format Decoding imagetops Filter Buffer Overflow
description: Heap-based buffer overflow in the read_rle16 function in imagetops in CUPS allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code via an SGI image with malformed Run Length Encoded (RLE) data containing a small image and a large row count.

name: Chilkat Email 'ChilkatCert.dll' ActiveX Control Insecure Method Vulnerability
description: Chilkat Email ActiveX control is prone to a vulnerability that allows attackers to create or overwrite arbitrary data with the privileges of the application using the control (typically Internet Explorer). Successful exploits can compromise affected computers or cause denial-of-service conditions; other attacks are possible.

name: Chilkat FTP 'ChilkatCert.dll' ActiveX Control Insecure Method Vulnerability
description: Chilkat FTP ActiveX control is prone to a vulnerability that allows attackers to create or overwrite arbitrary data with the privileges of the application using the control (typically Internet Explorer). Successful exploits can compromise affected computers or cause denial-of-service conditions; other attacks are possible.

name: Chilkat Socket ActiveX Arbitrary Remote File Creation Vulnerability
description: Chilkat ActiveX Control is prone to multiple vulnerabilities that allow attackers to overwrite arbitrary files. These issues affect multiple CLSIDs associated with the control. An attacker can exploit these issues by enticing an unsuspecting victim to view a malicious HTML page. Successfully exploiting these issues will allow the attacker to corrupt and overwrite arbitrary files on the victim's computer in the context of the vulnerable application using the ActiveX control.

name: Najdi.si Toolbar 'najdisitoolbar.dll' ActiveX Control Remote Buffer Overflow
description: Najdi.si Toolbar is prone to a stack-based buffer-overflow vulnerability because it fails to perform adequate boundary checks on user-supplied input. An attacker can exploit this issue to execute arbitrary code in the context of an application using the affected ActiveX control. Failed attacks will likely cause denial-of-service conditions.

name: Mozilla Firefox Security Bypass Vulnerability
description: Mozilla Firefox do not properly change the source URI when processing a canvas element and an HTTP redirect, which allows remote attackers to bypass the same origin policy and access arbitrary images that are not directly accessible to the attacker.

name: Digital Data Communications RtspVaPgCtrl ActiveX Control Buffer Overflow Vulnerability
description: Digital Data Communications RtspVaPgCtrl ActiveX control is prone to a buffer-overflow vulnerability because the application fails to perform adequate boundary checks on user-supplied data. Successfully exploiting this issue allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code in the context of the application using the ActiveX control (typically Internet Explorer). Failed exploit attempts likely result in denial-of-service conditions

name: Nessus SCANCTRL.ScanCtrlCtrl.1 ActiveX Control Vulnerability
description: Nessus SCANCTRL.ScanCtrlCtrl.1 ActiveX control is prone to multiple vulnerabilities. An attacker can exploit these issues to overwrite or delete arbitrary files on a victim's computer in the context of the vulnerable application using the ActiveX control. Attackers can also upload arbitrary files. Successful exploits will allow attackers to cause denial-of-service conditions and corrupt sensitive data; other consequences resulting from placing a malicious file on the system are also possible.

name: Mozilla Firefox -moz-binding Property Privilege Escalation Vulnerability
description: Firefox allows remote attackers to bypass the protection mechanism for codebase principals and execute arbitrary script via the -moz-binding CSS property in a signed JAR file.

name: CA Internet Security Suite 'UmxEventCli.dll' ActiveX Control Arbitrary File Overwrite
description: A Computer Associates Internet Security Suite ActiveX control is prone to a vulnerability that lets attackers overwrite files with arbitrary, attacker-controlled content. The issue occurs because the control fails to sanitize user-supplied input. Successful exploits will compromise affected computers and will aid in further attacks.

name: Microsoft VDT Database Designer VDT70.DLL ActiveX Control Buffer Overflow Vulnerability
description: Microsoft Visual Database Tools Database Designer ActiveX Control is prone to a buffer-overflow vulnerability because the application fails to handle overly long user-supplied strings. Attackers can exploit this issue to crash Internet Explorer or other applications that use the vulnerable ActiveX control, resulting in denial-of-service conditions; arbitrary code execution is also possible.

name: VeryPDF PDFView OCX ActiveX OpenPDF Heap Overflow
description: There is a vulnerability in VeryPDF, using which an attacker can cause Heap Overflow, by sending crafted packets.

name: HTTP File Upload ActiveX Control Arbitrary File And Directory Deletion Vulnerability
description: There exists a vulnerability with Upload ActiveX. When the vulnerable function is called maliciously through Internet Explorer, it can delete a file of any choice.

name: Mozilla Firefox Date Class Insufficient Validation Vulnerability
description: The JavaScript engine in Mozilla Firefox allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (crash) via vectors related to "insufficient class checking" in the Date class.

name: Microsoft Office 2000 UA OUACTRL.OCX ActiveX Control Buffer Overflow Vulnerability
description: Microsoft Office 2000 UA ActiveX Control is prone to a buffer-overflow vulnerability because the application fails to bounds-check user-supplied data before copying it into an insufficiently sized buffer. Successfully exploiting this issue allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code in the context of the application using the ActiveX control (typically Internet Explorer). Failed exploit attempts likely result in denial-of-service conditions.

name: SonicWALL SSL VPN Client Remote ActiveX Vulnerability
description: SonicWALL SSL VPN Client is prone to multiple remote vulnerabilities. The issues occur in different ActiveX controls and include arbitrary-file-deletion and multiple stack-based buffer-overflow vulnerabilities. Attackers can exploit these issues to execute arbitrary code within the context of the affected application and delete arbitrary files on the client's computer. Failed exploit attempts will result in denial-of-service conditions.

name: DVRHOST PDVRATL.DLL ActiveX Control Heap Based Buffer Overflow Vulnerability
description: The DVRHOST 'PdvrAtl.PdvrOcx.1' ActiveX control is prone to a heap-based buffer-overflow vulnerability because the application fails to perform adequate boundary checks on user-supplied data. Successfully exploiting this issue allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code in the context of the application using the ActiveX control (typically Internet Explorer). Failed exploit attempts likely result in denial-of-service conditions.

name: Interwoven WorkSite Web 'iManFile.cab' TransferCtrl Class ActiveX Control Double Free Vulnerability
description: Interwoven WorkSite Web TransferCtrl Class ActiveX control is prone to a double-free vulnerability because of a flaw in the way that it uses a certain JavaScript variable. Successfully exploiting this issue allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code in the context of the application using the ActiveX control (typically Internet Explorer). Failed exploit attempts likely result in denial-of-service conditions.

name: Apple CUPS Text-to-PostScript texttops Filter Integer Overflow
description: Integer overflow in the WriteProlog function in texttops in CUPS allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code via a crafted PostScript file that triggers a heap-based buffer overflow.

name: Microsoft Windows Media Player MIDI File MThd Header Parsing Denial Of Service Vulnerability
description: Microsoft Windows Media Player is prone to a denial-of-service vulnerability when processing a malformed MIDI file. A remote attacker can exploit this issue to crash the affected application, denying service to legitimate users.

name: Mozilla Firefox __proto__ mangling Assertion Failure Vulnerability
description: jslock.cpp in Mozilla Firefox 3.x before 3.0.2, Firefox 2.x before 2.0.0.18 before 1.1.13 allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (crash) and possibly execute arbitrary code by modifying the window.__proto__.__proto__ object in a way that causes a lock on a non-native object, which triggers an assertion failure related to the OBJ_IS_NATIVE function.

name: Mozilla Firefox nsXMLHttpRequest NotifyEventListeners Security Bypass Vulnerability
description: The nsXMLHttpRequest::NotifyEventListeners method in Firefox 3.x before 3.0.4 and Firefox 2.x before 2.0.0.18 allows remote attackers to bypass the same-origin policy and execute arbitrary script via multiple listeners, which bypass the inner window check.

name: Mozilla Firefox User Interface Dispatcher Null Pointer Dereference Denial Of Service Vulnerability
description: The user interface event dispatcher in Mozilla Firefox 3.0.3 on Windows XP SP2 allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (NULL pointer dereference and application crash) via a series of keypress, click, onkeydown, onkeyup, onmousedown, and onmouseup events.

name: Yahoo! Messenger Webcam Viewer YWCVWR.DLL ActiveX Control Denial Of Service
description: Yahoo! Messenger Webcam Viewer Networking and Imaging ActiveX control is prone to a denial-of-service vulnerability because it fails to perform adequate checks on user-supplied data. Successfully exploiting this issue allows remote attackers to crash applications that use the affected control. Remote code execution may also be possible, but has not been confirmed.

name: Mozilla Firefox .url Shortcut File Information Disclosure
description: Mozilla Firefox on Windows does not properly identify the context of Windows .url shortcut files, which allows user-assisted remote attackers to bypass the Same Origin Policy and obtain sensitive information via an HTML document that is directly accessible through a filesystem, as demonstrated by documents in (1) local folders, (2) Windows share folders, and (3) RAR archives, and as demonstrated by IFRAMEs referencing shortcuts that point to (a) about:cache?device=memory and (b) about:cache?device=disk, a variant of CVE-2008-2810.

name: Jive Software Openfire Jabber Server Authentication Bypass
description: An authentication bypass vulnerability exists in Openfire Server product by Jive Software. The vulnerability is due to an insecure design in the Tomcat filter where all functions in the admin webinterface are not protected from unauthorized access. Remote attackers could exploit this vulnerability to access functions in the admin web-interface without supplying valid credentials.

name: Mozilla Firefox Animated PNG Processing Integer Overflow
description:
An integer overflow vulnerability was reported in Mozilla Firefox. The flaw is due to integer overflow when processing animated PNG image files. 
The vulnerability could be exploited by persuading the target user to open a malicious web page. Successful attack could allow for arbitrary code injection and execution with privileges of the currently logged on user.

name: Mozilla Firefox XUL Frame Tree Memory Corruption
description: The layout engine in Mozilla Firefox allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (crash) via multiple vectors that trigger an assertion failure or other consequences.

name: Apple CUPS PNG Filter Overly Large Image Height Integer Overflow
description: There exists a buffer overflow vulnerability in Apple’s Common Unix Printing System (CUPS) distributed by multiple vendors. The vulnerability is due to a boundary error when handling PNG image format files. A remote attacker can exploit this vulnerability to inject and execute code with privileges of CUPS service.

name: Apple CUPS CSRF Remote Denial Of Service
description: A denial of service vulnerability exists in the way that CUPS daemon validates crafted CSRF requests.

name: ClamAV 'cli_check_jpeg_exploit' Function Malformed JPEG File Remote Denial Of Service
description: ClamAV is prone to a denial-of-service vulnerability. Attackers can exploit this issue to cause denial-of-service conditions. Given the nature of this issue, attackers may also be able to run arbitrary code, but this has not been confirmed.

name: Sun Solaris RPC sadmind PortMapper Decoder
description: When a client wishes to make an RPC call to an RPC application, it will first contact portmapper service on the server machine to determine the port number where RPC packets should be sent.This filter decodes the Unix port mapper traffic on port 111 to find out the ports those services are running on and configures firewall/IPS rules to use those ports.

name: Visagesoft eXPert PDF EditorX VSPDFEditorX.ocx Insecure Method Vulnerability
description: The vulnerability is due to insufficient input validation on user-supplied data passed to the method of an ActiveX Control of "VSPDFEditorX.ocx". A remote attacker could exploit the vulnerability via a web page that would pass the large crafted argument to the vulnerable methods of the ActiveX Control.

name: Parameter Validation Memory Corruption Vulnerability
description: A remote code execution vulnerability exists in the way Internet Explorer handles certain navigation methods. An attacker could exploit the vulnerability by constructing a specially crafted Web page. When a user views the Web page, the vulnerability could allow remote code execution. An attacker who successfully exploited this vulnerability could gain the same user rights as the logged-on user.

name: Hierarchical FlexGrid Control Memory Corruption Vulnerability
description: A remote code execution vulnerability exists in the Hierarchical FlexGrid ActiveX Control for Visual Basic 6. An attacker could exploit the vulnerability by constructing a specially crafted Web page. When a user views the Web page, the vulnerability could allow remote code execution. An attacker who successfully exploited this vulnerability could gain the same user rights as the logged-on user.

name: Charts Control Memory Corruption Vulnerability
description: A remote code execution vulnerability exists in the Charts ActiveX Control for Visual Basic 6. An attacker could exploit the vulnerability by constructing a specially crafted Web page. When a user views the Web page, the vulnerability could allow remote code execution. An attacker who successfully exploited this vulnerability could gain the same user rights as the logged-on user.

name: Masked Edit Control Memory Corruption Vulnerability
description: A remote code execution vulnerability exists in the Masked Edit ActiveX Control for Visual Basic 6. An attacker could exploit the vulnerability by constructing a specially crafted Web page. When a user views the Web page, the vulnerability could allow remote code execution. An attacker who successfully exploited this vulnerability could gain the same user rights as the logged-on user.

name: Word RTF Object Parsing Vulnerability
description: A remote code execution vulnerability exists in the way that Microsoft Office handles specially crafted Rich Text Format (RTF) files. The vulnerability could allow remote code execution if a user opens a specially crafted RTF file in Word or reads a specially crafted e-mail sent in the RTF format. An attacker who successfully exploited this vulnerability could take control of an affected system in the context of the currently logged-on user.

name: FlexGrid ActiveX Control Memory Corruption
description: Vulnerability exists in the FlexGrid ActiveX Control which could cause memory corruption that could lead to a crash in IE or remote code execution.

name: Microsoft Word Rich Text Format Object Parsing Vulnerability
description: A remote code execution vulnerability exists in the way that Microsoft Office handles specially crafted Rich Text Format (RTF) files. The vulnerability could allow remote code execution if a user opens a specially crafted RTF file in Word, or reads or previews a specially crafted e-mail sent in the RTF format. An attacker who successfully exploited this vulnerability could take control of an affected system in the context of the currently logged-on user.

name: Microsoft Word RTF Object Parsing Remote Code Execution
description: A remote code execution vulnerability exists in the way that Microsoft Office handles specially crafted Rich Text Format (RTF) files. The vulnerability could allow remote code execution if a user opens a specially crafted RTF file in Word, or reads or previews a specially crafted e-mail sent in the RTF format. An attacker who successfully exploited this vulnerability could take control of an affected system in the context of the currently logged-in user.

name: Microsoft Word RTF Object Parsing Remote Code Execution Vulnerability
description: A remote code execution vulnerability exists in the way that Microsoft Office handles specially crafted Rich Text Format (RTF) files. The vulnerability could allow remote code execution if a user opens a specially crafted RTF file in Word or reads or previews a specially crafted e-mail sent in the RTF format. An attacker who successfully exploited this vulnerability could take control of an affected system in the context of the currently logged-in user.

name: BitDefender Infinite Loop Denial Of Service
description: The vulnerability is caused due to a boundary error in the "pdf.xmd" module when processing data encoded using e.g. the "FlateDecode" and "ASCIIHexDecode" filters. This can be exploited to cause a memory corruption via a specially crafted PDF file. Successful exploitation may allow execution of arbitrary code.

name: Microsoft GDI+ GIF Parsing Vulnerability
description: gdiplus.dll in GDI+ allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code via a GIF image file with a "malformed graphic control extension," aka "GDI+ GIF Parsing Vulnerability."

name: Net-SNMP GETBULK Remote Denial Of Service Vulnerability
description: Integer overflow in the netsnmp_create_subtree_cache function in agent/snmp_agent.c in net-snmp allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (crash) via a crafted SNMP GETBULK request, which triggers a heap-based buffer overflow,  related to the number of responses or repeats.

name: Adobe Acrobat/Acrobat Reader ActiveX Control Buffer Overflow Vulnerability
description: Buffer overflow in the ActiveX component (pdf.ocx) for Adobe Acrobat 5.0.5 and Acrobat Reader, and possibly other versions, allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code via a URI for a PDF file with a null terminator (%00) followed by a long string.

name: IIS and SiteServer Showcode.asp sample file allows remote file viewing
description: The showcode.asp sample file shipped with Microsoft Internet Information Server (IIS) 4.0 and SiteServer 3.x can be remotely exploited to read arbitrary files on vulnerable servers. This file is one of several sample files distributed with IIS 4.0 and SiteServer 3.x that allow remote file viewing.

name: IIS ASP Alternate Data Streams Vulnerability
description: Microsoft IIS and other NT webservers contain a vulnerability that allows remote users to obtain the source code for an ASP file. When one appends ::$DATA to an asp being requested, the ASP source will be returned, instead of executing the ASP. For example: http://xyz/myasp.asp::$DATA will return the source of myasp.asp, instead of executing it. CVE-1999-0278

name: IIS ExAir Search DoS
description:
Internet Information Server (IIS) is a Web server from Microsoft Corporation. IIS version 4.0 includes a sample Website called ExAir, which is coded in Active Server Pages (ASP).

A vulnerability exists with ExAir because if a certain ExAir .asp file is accessed directly, rather than through the main page, the required dynamic libraries would not be loaded correctly and the IIS server would consume all of the Central Processing Unit's (CPU) resources. The vulnerable files include /search/advsearch.asp, /search/query.asp, and /search/search.asp.

Remote attackers could exploit this vulnerability to execute a Denial of Service (DoS) attack on an affected server.

name: IIS fpcount.exe Buffer Overflow Vulnerability
description: Buffer overflow in fpcount.exe in IIS with FrontPage Server Extensions allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary commands.

name: Microsoft IIS IISADMPWD Proxied Password Attack
description: By default, IIS 4.0 has a virtual directory /IISADMPWD which contains files that can be used as proxies for brute force password attacks, or to identify valid users on the system. CVE-1999-0407

name: MS Frontpage htimage.exe Path Leak Vulnerability
description: Microsoft Windows NT 4.0 running Internet Information Server with FrontPage Server Extensions (FPSE) version 98 or 2000 could reveal sensitive information to an attacker. A remote attacker could make an HTTP GET request to the htimage.exe file on the server to learn the physical path that the file is located in on the affected system. The htimage.exe program is found in the /scripts or /cgi-bin directory. An attacker could use this information with malicious intent.

name: MS IIS bdir.htr Vulnerability
description: In Microsoft Internet Information Server (IIS) version 3.0, the ism.dll file, used to manage remote administration scripts for IIS, is protected by an authentication scheme specific to IIS version 3.0. One of these remote administration scripts used under IIS 3.0, bdir.htr, also functions under IIS version 4.0. However, because the authentication scheme used in IIS 3.0 differs from the scheme used in IIS 4.0, the bdir.htr script can be accessed remotely without authentication. A remote attacker could use the bdir.htr script to view the names of directories on the server. Though the attacker is limited to only viewing server directory information, this information could be useful to an attacker in performing further attacks.

name: MS IIS Index Server File Information and Path Disclosure
description: SQLQHit.asp sample file in Microsoft Index Server 2.0 allows remote attackers to obtain sensitive information such as the physical path, file attributes, or portions of source code by directly calling sqlqhit.asp with a CiScope parameter set to (1) webinfo, (2) extended_fileinfo, (3) extended_webinfo, or (4) fileinfo.

name: MS Index Server '%20' ASP Source Disclosure Vulnerability
description:
Index Server can be used to cause IIS to display the source of .asp and possibly other server-side processed files. 

By appending a space (%20) to the end of the filename specified in the 'CiWebHitsFile' variable, and setting 'CiHiliteType' to 'Full' and 'CiRestriction' to 'None', it is possible to retrieve the unprocessed source of the file.

This is possible on any machine with Index Server installed, even those with no normal .htw files, because the virtual file null.htw is stored in memory and the .htw extension is mapped by default to webhits.dll .

name: MS06-053 - Vulnerability in Indexing Service Could Allow Cross-Site Scripting (.htw)
description: There is an information disclosure vulnerability in the Indexing Service because of the way that it handles query validation. The vulnerability could allow an attacker to run client-side script on behalf of a user. The script could spoof content, disclose information, or take any action that the user could take on the affected Web site.

name: MS06-053- Vulnerability in Indexing Service could allow cross site scripting
description: UTF-7 (7-bit Unicode Transformation Format) is a variable-length character encoding that was proposed for representing Unicode-encoded text using a stream of ASCII characters

name: NT IIS4 Remote Web-Based Administration Vulnerability
description: Web-based administration for IIS 4.0 is, by default, limited to the local loopback address, 127.0.0.1. In instances where IIS4.0 was installed as an upgrade to IIS 2.0 or 3.0, a legacy ISAPI DLL (ISM.DLL) is left in the /scripts/iisadmin directory. An attacker may call this DLL. It may allow them to gather sensitive information about the web server and its configuration.

name: Oracle Rapid Install Cross-Site Scripting Vulnerability
description: A vulnerability has been reported in Oracle Rapid Install, which can be exploited by malicious people to conduct cross-site scripting attacks.

name: Trend Micro ServerProtect Crystal Reports ReportServer File Disclosure
description: Remote exploitation of an input validation vulnerability in Trend Micro Inc.'s ServerProtect Management Console allows remote attackers to view the contents of arbitrary files on the underlying system.

name: Vulnerability in View Code.asp IIS file.
description: The viewcode.asp sample file in IIS and Site Server allows remote attackers to read arbitrary files.

name: Web Server Oracle Cross Site Scripting in SnoopServlet
description: Unspecified vulnerability in OC4J for Oracle Application Server 9.0.2.3, 9.0.3.1, 9.0.4.2, and 10.1.2.0.0 has unknown impact and attack vectors, aka Oracle Vuln# (1) AS05 and (2) AS08.

name: Web Server Oracle Cross-Site-Scripting Vulnerability in Oracle Secure Enterprise Search
description: Oracle Secure Enterprise Search 10g, a standalone product from Oracle, enables a secure, high quality, easy-to-use search across all enterprise information assets.The parameter EXPTYPE in boundary_rules.jsp contains a cross site scripting vulnerability.

name: Microsoft HTML Object Memory Corruption Vulnerability
description: A remote code execution vulnerability exists in Internet Explorer due to attempts to access uninitialized memory in certain situations.  An attacker could exploit the vulnerability by constructing a specially crafted Web page. When a user views the Web page, the vulnerability could allow remote code execution. An attacker who successfully exploited this vulnerability could gain the same user rights as the logged on user.

name: Evans FTP 'EvansFTP.ocx' ActiveX Control Remote Buffer Overflow Vulnerability
description: Evans FTP ActiveX control is prone to multiple remote buffer-overflow vulnerabilities because the application fails to perform adequate boundary checks on user-supplied data. Successfully exploiting these issues allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code in the context of the application using the ActiveX control (typically Internet Explorer). Failed exploit attempts will likely result in denial-of-service conditions.

name: HTML Rendering Memory Corruption Vulnerability
description: A remote code execution vulnerability exists in the way Internet Explorer embeds objects into a Web page. An attacker could exploit the vulnerability by constructing a specially crafted Web page. When a user views the Web page, the vulnerability could allow remote code execution. An attacker who successfully exploited this vulnerability could gain the same user rights as the logged on user.

name: Aztec ActiveX 'Aztec.dll' ActiveX Control Arbitrary File Overwrite Vulnerability
description: Aztec ActiveX is prone to multiple vulnerabilities that let attackers overwrite files with arbitrary, attacker-controlled content. Successful exploits will compromise affected computers and will aid in further attacks. Aztec ActiveX 3.0.0.1 is vulnerable; other versions may also be affected.

name: Mozilla Firefox File Input Element Memory Corruption
description: nsFrameManager in Firefox allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (crash) and possibly execute arbitrary code by modifying properties of a file input element while it is still being initialized, then using the blur method to access uninitialized memory.

name: Mozilla Firefox XUL Iframe Denial Of Service
description: The layout engine in Mozilla Firefox 3.x before 3.0.5 and 2.x before 2.0.0.19 allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (crash) and possibly trigger memory corruption via vectors related to (1) a reahable assertion or (2) an integer overflow.

name: Mozilla Firefox Layout Engine Denial Of Service Vulnerability
description: The layout engine in Mozilla Firefox 3.x before 3.0.5 and 2.x before 2.0.0.19 allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (crash) and possibly trigger memory corruption via vectors related to (1) a reahable assertion or (2) an integer overflow.

name: CUPS 'HP-GL/2' Filter Remote Code Execution Vulnerability
description: The Hewlett-Packard Graphics Language (HPGL) filter in CUPS before 1.3.9 allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code via crafted pen width and pen color opcodes that overwrite arbitrary memory.

name: Mozilla Firefox URL Parsing Vulnerability
description: Mozilla Firefox 3.x before 3.0.5 and 2.x before 2.0.0.19, Thunderbird 2.x before 2.0.0.19, and SeaMonkey 1.x before 1.1.14 does not properly parse URLs with leading whitespace or control characters, which might allow remote attackers to misrepresent URLs and simplify phishing attacks.

name: CA ARCserve Backup Directory Traversal Vulnerability
description: Directory traversal vulnerability in the RPC interface (asdbapi.dll) in CA ARCserve Backup (formerly BrightStor ARCserve Backup) r11.1 through r12.0 allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary commands via a .. (dot dot) in an RPC call with opnum 0x10A.

name: Jive Software Openfire Jabber Server SQL Injection
description: A SQL injection vulnerability exists in Openfire Server product by Jive Software. The vulnerability is due to lack of data validation of user input. Remote attackers could exploit this vulnerability to inject and execute SQL statement with privileges of the affected service.

name: Mozilla Firefox GetXMLEntity And FastAppendChar Denial Of Service
description: The layout engine in Mozilla Firefox 3.x before 3.0.5, Thunderbird 2.x before 2.0.0.19 allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (crash) via vectors that trigger memory corruption, related to the GetXMLEntity and FastAppendChar functions.

name: EasyMail Objects 'emmailstore.dll ' ActiveX Control Remote Buffer Overflow Vulnerability
description: EasyMail Objects ActiveX control is prone to a remote buffer-overflow vulnerability because the application fails to perform adequate boundary checks on user-supplied data. Successfully exploiting this issue allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code in the context of the application using the ActiveX control (typically Internet Explorer). Failed exploit attempts likely result in denial-of-service conditions.

name: Internet Explorer 'chromeHTML://' Command Line Parameter Injection Vulnerability
description:
Internet Explorer is prone to a vulnerability that lets attackers inject command-line parameters through protocol handlers. This issue occurs because the application fails to adequately sanitize user-supplied input.
Exploiting this issue would permit remote attackers to influence command options that can be called through the vulnerable protocol handler and to execute commands with the privileges of a user running the application. Attackers may also be able to leverage this issue to execute arbitrary code with the privileges of the user running the vulnerable application.

name: Trend Micro ServerProtect Configuration Request Buffer Overflow
description: Trend Micro ServerProtect is prone to multiple remote vulnerabilities, including an authentication-bypass issue and multiple heap-based buffer-overflow issues. Successfully exploiting the buffer-overflow issues may allow an attacker to execute arbitrary code with SYSTEM-level privileges or crash the affected application, denying service to legitimate users. Successfully exploiting the authentication-bypass vulnerability will allow the attacker administrative access to the vulnerable application.

name: Mozilla Firefox Escaped Null Character Security Bypass Vulnerability
description: The CSS parser in Mozilla Firefox 3.x before 3.0.5 and 2.x before 2.0.0.19 ignores the '\0' escaped null character, which might allow remote attackers to bypass protection mechanisms such as sanitization routines.

name: Microsoft Internet Explorer JavaScript Event Handler Memory Overwrite
description: There exists an overflow in Microsoft Internet Explorer (mshtml.dll ) which  can be triggered by specifying large amounts of javascript event handlers (such as onLoad, onMouseMove) for any single HTML tag. Due to a programming error, MSIE will then attempt to write memory array out of bounds, at an offset corresponding to four times the ID of the event action handler.

name: Microsoft PowerPoint Unspecified Code Execution
description: A vulnerability has been identified in Microsoft PowerPoint, which could be exploited by attackers to take complete control of an affected system. This flaw is due to a memory corruption error when handling a malformed presentation, which could be exploited by attackers to execute arbitrary commands by tricking a user into opening a specially crafted document.

name: Microsoft Internet Explorer HTML Rendering Memory Corruption Vulnerability
description: A remote code execution vulnerability exists in the way Internet Explorer interprets HTML with certain layout combinations. An attacker could exploit the vulnerability by constructing a specially crafted Web page. When a user views the Web page, the vulnerability could allow remote code execution. An attacker who successfully exploited this vulnerability could gain the same user rights as the logged on user.

name: DataGrid ActiveX Control Memory Corruption
description: Vulnerability exists in the DataGrid ActiveX Control which could cause memory corruption that could lead to a crash in IE or remote code execution.

name: Jive Openfire Jabber Server Authentication Bypass
description: An authentication bypass vulnerability exists in Openfire Server product by Jive Software. The vulnerability is due to an insecure design in the Tomcat filter where all functions in the admin web interface are not protected from unauthorized access. Remote attackers could exploit this vulnerability to access functions in the admin web-interface without supplying valid credentials.

name: Ultra Crypto Component ActiveX Control SaveToFile Arbitrary File Overwrite Vulnerability
description: Ultra Crypto Component ActiveX Control is prone to a vulnerability that lets attackers overwrite arbitrary files. An attacker can exploit this issue to overwrite files with arbitrary, attacker-controlled content. This will aid in further attacks.

name: EDraw Flowchart ActiveX Control Arbitrary File Overwrite Vulnerability
description: The EDraw Flowchart ActiveX Control is prone to a vulnerability that lets attackers overwrite files with arbitrary, attacker-controlled content. This will aid in further attacks. EDraw Flowchart ActiveX Control 2.3 is vulnerable to this issue; other versions may also be affected.

name: Word Memory Corruption Vulnerability
description: Microsoft Office Word 2000 SP3 and 2002 SP3 and Office 2004 for Mac allow remote attackers to execute arbitrary code via a Word document with a crafted lcbPlcfBkfSdt field in the File Information Block (FIB), which bypasses an initialization step and triggers an "arbitrary free," aka "Word Memory Corruption Vulnerability."

name: BitDefender 'pdf.xmd' Module PDF Parsing Remote Denial Of Service
description: BitDefender is prone to a remote denial-of-service vulnerability that occurs when a malicious PDF file is scanned using BitDefender's command-line scanner 'bdc.exe'. Attackers can exploit this issue to deny service to legitimate users.

name: Samba Root File System Access Security Issue
description: Samba, when registry shares are enabled, allows remote authenticated users to access the root file system via a crafted connection request that specifies a blank share name.

name: ChilkatSocket.DLL Arbitrary File Creation Vulnerability
description: Chilkat ActiveX control is prone to a vulnerability that lets attackers overwrite arbitrary files.

name: Ultra Crypto Component CryptoX.dll ActiveX Control Remote Buffer Overflow Vulnerability
description: Ultra Crypto Component ActiveX control is prone to multiple buffer-overflow vulnerabilities because it fails to perform adequate boundary checks on user-supplied data. Successfully exploiting these issues allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code in the context of the application using the ActiveX control (typically Internet Explorer). Failed exploit attempts likely result in denial-of-service conditions.

name: SMB Buffer Overflow Remote Code Execution Vulnerability
description: An unauthenticated remote code execution vulnerability exists in the way that Microsoft Server Message Block (SMB) Protocol software handles specially crafted SMB packets. An attempt to exploit the vulnerability would not require authentication, allowing an attacker to exploit the vulnerability by sending a specially crafted network message to a computer running the Server service. An attacker who successfully exploited this vulnerability could take complete control of the system.

name: MS IIS Frontpage Server Extensions Path Disclosure
description: The local path of a HTML, HTM, ASP, or SHTML file can be disclosed in Microsoft IIS 4.0/5.0 / Frontpage Server Extensions 1.1 and prior. Passing a path to a non-existent file to the shtml.exe or shtml.dll (depending on platform) program will display an error message stating that the file cannot be found accompanied by the full local path to the web root.

name: Oracle TimesTen Remote Format String Vulnerability
description: A string format vulnerability in the TimesTen Data Server component in Oracle Database allows remote attackers to affect confidentiality, integrity, and availability.

name: Oracle E-Business Suite Business Intelligence SQL Injection Vulnerability
description: This vulnerability allows remote attackers to inject arbitrary SQL on vulnerable installations of Oracle E-Business Suite Business Intelligence. Authentication is not required to exploit this vulnerability. The specific flaw exists in the APPS.ICXSUPWF.DisplayContacts package. The procedure fails to validate the contents of a WHERE clause containing user supplied input. This allows an attacker to execute arbitrary SQL statements in the context of the APPS user.

name: Adobe Acrobat Reader Denial Of Service Vulnerability
description: Adobe Acrobat Reader 8.1.2 and earlier allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (application crash) and possibly execute arbitrary code via a malformed PDF document.

name: MetaProducts MetaTreeX ActiveX File Overwrite Vulnerability
description: MetaProducts MetaTreeX is prone to a Remote File Execution Vulnerability, that lets attackers to gain access by specially crafted files.

name: EDraw Office Viewer Component ActiveX Control Arbitrary File Overwrite Vulnerability
description: The EDraw Office Viewer Component ActiveX Control is prone to a vulnerability that lets attackers overwrite files. An attacker can exploit this issue to overwrite files with arbitrary, attacker-controlled content. This will aid in further attacks.

name: Mozilla Firefox 'designMode' Null Pointer Dereference Denial Of Service Vulnerability
description: Mozilla Firefox is prone to a remote denial-of-service vulnerability. Successful exploits can allow attackers to crash the affected browser, resulting in denial-of-service conditions.

name: Mozilla Firefox xdg-open 'mailcap' File Remote Code Execution Vulnerability
description: Mozilla Firefox is prone to a remote code-execution vulnerability because the browser fails to properly validate the 'mime-type' of files before calling the 'xdg-open' utility, as defined in '/etc/mailcap'. An attacker can exploit this issue to execute arbitrary code within the context of the affected browser.

name: Symantec Backup Exec For Windows Servers Authentication Vulnerability
description: Multiple errors in several authentication methods used by a Backup Exec Remote Agent can be exploited to gain unauthorized access to the application and e.g. read or delete arbitrary files.

name: Microsoft Internet Explorer 'screen[""]' Remote Denial Of Service Vulnerability
description: Microsoft Internet Explorer is prone to a remote denial-of-service vulnerability. Attackers can exploit this issue by enticing an unsuspecting victim to view a malicious web page. Successfully exploiting this issue will cause the application to crash, denying service to legitimate users.

name: Excel Viewer OCX Remote File Execution Vulnerability
description: There are some vulnerabilities in Excel Viewer OCX.The vulnerabilities are caused due to boundary errors within the Excel Viewer ActiveX control (ExcelViewer.ocx). These can be exploited to cause stack-based buffer overflows via overly long arguments passed to certain methods (e.g. "HttpDownloadFile()" or "OpenWebFile()").Successful exploitation may allow execution of arbitrary code when a user visits a malicious website.

name: Word Viewer OCX 3.2 Remote File Execution Vulnerability
description: There are some vulnerabilities in Word Viewer OCX.The vulnerabilities are caused due to boundary errors within the Word Viewer ActiveX control (WordViewer.ocx). These can be exploited to cause stack-based buffer overflows via overly long arguments passed to certain methods (e.g. "HttpDownloadFile()" or "OpenWebFile()").Successful exploitation may allow execution of arbitrary code when a user visits a malicious website.

name: Multiple Vendor SizerOne ActiveX Control 'AddTab' Method Buffer Overflow Vulnerability
description: The SizerOne ActiveX control used in products by multiple vendors is prone to a buffer-overflow vulnerability because it fails to properly bounds-check user-supplied data before copying it into an insufficiently sized memory buffer. An attacker can exploit this issue to execute arbitrary code within the context of the application that uses the ActiveX control (typically Internet Explorer). Failed exploit attempts will result in denial-of-service conditions.

name: Cerulean Studios Trillian AIM XML Tag Handling Heap Buffer Overflow
description: Heap-based buffer overflow in the XML parser in the AIM plugin in Trillian before 3.1.12.0 allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code via a malformed XML tag.

name: Oracle Database EXFSYS.DBMS_EXPFIL_DR.GET_EXPRSET_STATS SQL Injection
description: A SQL Injection vulnerability exists in procedure GET_EXPRSET_STATS of the DBMS_EXPFIL_DR package.

name: VMware "vmware-authd" Denial Of Service
description: A vulnerability exists in VMware that can be exploited by malicious people to cause a DoS (Denial of Service). The vulnerability is caused due to an error in the "vmware-authd" daemon when processing overly long strings.

name: Microsoft Windows .CHM Denial Of Service
description: Microsoft Windows is prone to a denial of service vulnerability that lets attackers crash explorer by sending specially crafted .chm files.

name: Microsoft HTML Workshop Universal Buffer Overflow
description: Microsoft HTML Workshop is prone to a buffer overflow vulnerability that lets attackers gain access to the system by sending specially crafted hhp files.

name: SmartVmd ActiveX Remote File Overwrite/Deletion Vulnerability
description: SmartVmd is prone to a Remote File Overwrite/Deletion Vulnerability.An attacker can exploit this issue to execute arbitrary code within the context of the affected application.

name: FlexCell Grid Control Remote File Overwrite Vulnerability
description: FlexCell Grid Control is prone to a Remote File Overwrite Vulnerability.An attacker can exploit this issue to execute arbitrary code within the context of the affected application.

name: NCTVideoStudio ActiveX Insecure Method Vulnerability
description: NCTVideoStudio Server is prone to a Insecure Method Vulnerability.An attacker can exploit this issue to execute arbitrary code within the context of the affected application.

name: Trillian Image Filename Handling XML Tag Stack Buffer Overflow
description: Stack-based buffer overflow in the image tooltip implementation in Trillian before 3.1.12.0 allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code via a long image filename, related to "AIM IMG Tag Parsing."

name: Symantec AppStream Client LaunchObj ActiveX Control Arbitrary Program Execution
description: The LaunchObj ActiveX control in launcher.dll in Symantec AppStream Client does not properly validate downloaded files, which allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code via the installAppMgr method and unspecified other methods.

name: MPlayer demux_open_vqf TwinVQ File Handling Buffer Overflow
