When a user views the Web page, the vulnerability could allow remote code execution. An attacker who successfully exploited this vulnerability could gain the same user rights as the logged-on user.

name: Microsoft Windows Media Player ScriptCommand Information Disclosure Vulnerability
description: Microsoft Windows Media Player is prone to multiple information-disclosure vulnerabilities because it fails to properly restrict access to certain functionality when handling media files. An attacker can exploit these vulnerabilities to obtain information that may aid in further attacks.

name: Microsoft Windows Embedded OpenType Font Denial Of Service
description: A vulnerability exists in Microsoft Windows, which can be exploited to cause a DoS (Denial of Service). The vulnerability is caused due to an error when processing Embedded OpenType fonts. This can be exploited to crash an affected system.

name: Microsoft Windows Active Directory Modify Request Remote Code Execution
description: Heap overflow vulnerability exists in Microsoft Windows Active Directory Protocol which can be used by malicious users to launch remote code execution on the affected system and compromise it.

name: Office Web Components Memory Allocation Vulnerability
description: A remote code execution vulnerability exists in the Office Web Components ActiveX Control. An attacker could exploit the vulnerability by constructing a specially crafted Web page. When a user views the Web page, the vulnerability could allow remote code execution. An attacker who successfully exploited this vulnerability could gain the same user rights as the logged-on user.

name: Oracle Secure Backup Administration Server Command Injection
description:
Oracle Secure backup server is prone to a command injection vulnerability which is caused due to improper filtering of user supplied data to the property_box.php script used in the Administration server. Successful exploitation may allow a remote authenticated attacker to execute arbitrary
commands under the credentials of the system account.

name: Oracle Database REPCAT_RPC.VALIDATE_REMOTE_RC SQL Injection
description: Unspecified vulnerability in the Advanced Replication component in Oracle Database allows remote authenticated users to affect confidentiality and integrity via unknown vectors.

name: Novell Client For Windows ActiveX Remote DoS
description: There exists a remote denial of service vulnerability in Novell Client for Windows. Successful exploitation may result in crash of the client, thereby loss of service to legitimate users.

name: Microsoft IIS FTPd Remote Buffer Overflow Vulnerability
description: Microsoft IIS is prone to a remote stack-based buffer-overflow vulnerability affecting the application's FTP server. An attacker can exploit this issue to execute arbitrary code within the context of the affected application. Failed exploit attempts will result in a denial-of-service condition.

name: SmartVMD ActiveX Control 'VideoMovementDetection.dll' Buffer Overflow
description: SmartVMD ActiveX control is prone to a buffer-overflow vulnerability because the application fails to adequately check boundaries on user-supplied input. An attacker can exploit this issue to execute arbitrary code in the context of the application using the ActiveX control. Failed attacks will likely cause denial-of-service conditions.

name: Windows Media Header Parsing Invalid Free Vulnerability
description: A remote code execution vulnerability exists in the way that Microsoft Windows handles specially crafted ASF format files. This vulnerability could allow remote code execution if a user opened a specially crafted file. If a user is logged on with administrative user rights, an attacker who successfully exploited this vulnerability could take complete control of an affected system.

name: Microsoft IIS FTPd Unspecified Remote Denial Of Service
description: Stack consumption vulnerability in the FTP server in Microsoft Internet Information Server (IIS) allows remote authenticated users to cause a denial of service (crash) via crafted list (dir) and nlst (ls) commands.

name: Microsoft Internet Explorer Javascript SetAttribute Remote Denial Of Service
description: Microsoft Internet Explorer is prone to a remote denial-of-service vulnerability. Attackers can exploit this issue by enticing an unsuspecting victim to view a malicious web page. Successfully exploiting this issue will cause the application to crash, denying service to legitimate users.

name: Squid strListGetItem Denial Of Service
description: A denial of service vulnerability exists in the way Squid handles HTTP headers, which is caused due to an infinite loop error when processing HTTP headers containing a specific delimiter character. Successful exploitation can consume system resources and may cause the service to terminate.

name: Mozilla Firefox 'watch()' And ' __defineSetter__ ()' Functions Remote Code Execution Vulnerability
description: Mozilla Firefox before 3.0.12 does not properly handle an SVG element that has a property with a watch function and an __defineSetter__ function, which allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (memory corruption and application crash) or possibly execute arbitrary code via a crafted document, related to a certain pointer misinterpretation.

name: Microsoft Windows RPCSS DCOM Interface DoS
description: The Microsoft RPCSS Service is responsible for managing Remote Procedure Call (RPC) messages. There are two buffer overflow vulnerabilities in the RPCSS service, which is enabled by default on many versions of Microsoft Windows. These buffer overflows occur in sections of code that handle DCOM activation messages sent to the RPCSS service.

name: Microsoft Windows NTLM Authentication RPC DoS
description: A denial of service vulnerability exists in the remote procedure call (RPC) facility due to a failure in communicating with the NTLM security provider when performing authentication of RPC requests. An anonymous attacker could exploit the vulnerability by sending a specially crafted RPC authentication request to a computer over the network. An attacker who successfully exploited this vulnerability could cause the computer to stop responding and automatically restart.

name: Microsoft Windows RPC DCOM Interface Overflow
description: Microsoft Windows 2000, Windows NT 4.0, Windows XP, and Windows Server 2003 are vulnerable to a buffer overflow in the Distributed Component Object Model (DCOM) interface of the RPC (Remote Procedure Call) service. By sending a malformed message to the RPC service, a remote attacker can overflow a buffer and execute arbitrary code on the system with Local System privileges.

name: DHTML Editing Component ActiveX Control Vulnerability
description: A remote code execution vulnerability exists in the DHTML Editing Component ActiveX Control. An attacker could exploit the vulnerability by constructing a specially crafted Web page. When a user views the Web page, the vulnerability could allow remote code execution. An attacker who successfully exploited this vulnerability could gain the same user rights as the logged-on user.

name: Microsoft Windows RPCSS DCOM Interface Long Filename Heap Corruption
description: The Microsoft RPCSS Service is responsible for managing Remote Procedure Call (RPC) messages. There are two buffer overflow vulnerabilities in the RPCSS service, which is enabled by default on many versions of Microsoft Windows. These buffer overflows occur in sections of code that handle DCOM activation messages sent to the RPCSS service.

name: JScript Remote Code Execution Vulnerability
description: A remote code execution vulnerability exists in the way that the JScript scripting engine processes scripts in Web pages. The vulnerability could allow remote code execution if a user opened a specially crafted file or visited a Web site that is running a specially crafted script. If a user is logged on with administrative user rights, an attacker who successfully exploited this vulnerability could take complete control of an affected system.

name: MS Windows Messenger Service Buffer Overrun (MS03-043)
description: The Messenger Service for Windows NT through Server 2003 does not properly verify the length of the message, which allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code via a buffer overflow attack.

name: Adobe Flash Player ActionScript intrf_count Integer Overflow
description: Integer overflow in Adobe Flash Player allows attackers to cause a denial of service (application crash) or possibly execute arbitrary code via unspecified vectors.

name: FTPShell Client Remote Buffer Overflow
description: FTPShell Client is prone to a remote buffer-overflow vulnerability because it fails to perform adequate boundary checks on user-supplied data. This issue occurs when handling a specially crafted 'CWD' command. An attacker may exploit this issue to execute arbitrary code in the context of the vulnerable application. Failed exploit attempts will likely result in a denial-of-service condition.

name: Internet Explorer URL Path Spoofing Vulnerability
description: Microsoft Internet Explorer allows remote attackers to spoof the address bar, via window.open with a relative URI, to show an arbitrary URL on the web site visited by the victim. Successful exploitation requires the ability to modify page content on a host that a user may consider partly trusted.

name: Lotus Notes Connector For Blackberry Manager ActiveX DoS
description: The Lotus Notes Connector for Blackberry Manager ActiveX control (lnresobject.dll) is vulnerable to a denial of service. By persuading a victim to visit a malicious Web page, a remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability to cause the victim's browser to crash.

name: Ipswitch WS_FTP Professional Remote Format String Vulnerability
description: Ipswitch WS_FTP Professional client is prone to a format-string vulnerability because it fails to properly sanitize user-supplied input before passing it as the format specifier to a formatted-printing function. An attacker may exploit this issue to execute arbitrary code in the context of the vulnerable application. Failed exploit attempts will likely result in a denial-of-service condition.

name: iDefense COMRaider ActiveX Control Insecure Method Vulnerability
description: iDefense COMRaider ActiveX control is prone to multiple insecure-method vulnerabilities. Successful exploitation allows remote attackers to create arbitrary directories and copy arbitrary local files, which can lead to a denial of service condition or aid in further attacks.

name: Adobe ShockWave Player ActiveX Buffer Overflow
description:
Adobe Shockwave Player ActiveX control is prone to a remote buffer-overflow vulnerability because the application fails to perform adequate boundary checks on user-supplied data.

Successfully exploiting this issue allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code in the context of the application using the ActiveX control (typically Internet Explorer). Failed exploit attempts likely result in denial-of-service conditions.

name: Novell GroupWise Client 'gxmim1.dll' ActiveX Control Buffer Overflow
description: Novell GroupWise Client is prone to an unspecified buffer-overflow vulnerability because the application fails to perform adequate boundary checks on user-supplied data. Successful exploits allow remote attackers to execute arbitrary code in the context of the application using the ActiveX control. Failed exploit attempts will likely result in denial-of-service conditions.

name: Mozilla Firefox Multiplatform Remote Code Execution Via pkcs11 Module
description: Mozilla Firefox does not properly implement certain dialogs associated with the (1) pkcs11.addmodule and (2) pkcs11.deletemodule operations, which makes it easier for remote attackers to trick a user into installing or removing an arbitrary PKCS11 module.

name: IP Security Camera ActiveX Controls 'url' Attribute Buffer Overflow Vulnerability
description: Various IP Security Camera ActiveX controls are prone to a remote buffer-overflow vulnerability because the applications fail to properly bounds-check user-supplied data before copying it into insufficiently sized memory buffers. Exploiting this issue may allow remote attackers to execute arbitrary code in the context of applications that use the affected ActiveX control (typically Internet Explorer) and to compromise affected computers. Failed attempts will likely result in denial-of-service conditions.

name: VLC Media Player 'demux\tta.c' TTA File Handling Buffer Overflow Vulnerability
description: Integer overflow in the Open function in modules/demux/tta.c in VLC Media Player allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (application crash) or possibly execute arbitrary code via a crafted TTA file, which triggers a heap-based buffer overflow.

name: Mozilla Firefox TreeColumns Dangling Pointer Vulnerability
description: Mozilla Firefox does not properly manage pointers for the columns (aka TreeColumns) of a XUL tree element, which allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code via a crafted HTML document, related to a "dangling pointer vulnerability."

name: Mozilla Firefox nsPropertyTable PropertyList Memory Corruption
description: Multiple unspecified vulnerabilities in the browser engine in Mozilla Firefox allow remote attackers to cause a denial of service (memory corruption and application crash) or possibly execute arbitrary code via unknown vectors.

name: Altiris eXpress NS SC Download ActiveX Control Arbitrary File Download Vulnerability
description: Altiris eXpress NS SC Download ActiveX control is prone to a vulnerability that can allow malicious files to be downloaded and saved to arbitrary locations on an affected computer. Attackers may exploit this issue to put malicious files in arbitrary locations and execute them within the context of the affected application that uses the affected control (typically Internet Explorer). Other attacks are also possible.

name: Dnsmasq TFTP Service Remote Heap Buffer Overflow
description: Heap-based buffer overflow in the tftp_request function in tftp.c in dnsmasq before 2.50, when --enable-tftp is used, might allow remote attackers to execute arbitrary code via a long filename in a TFTP packet, as demonstrated by a read (aka RRQ) request.

name: Mozilla Firefox Top-level Script Object Offset Calculation Memory Corruption
description: Unspecified vulnerability in the JavaScript engine in Mozilla Firefox 3.5.x before 3.5.3 allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (memory corruption and application crash) or possibly execute arbitrary code via unknown vectors.

name: Multiple Vendors NTP Daemon Autokey Stack Buffer Overflow
description: Stack-based buffer overflow in the crypto_recv function in ntp_crypto.c in ntpd in NTP, when OpenSSL and autokey are enabled, allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code via a crafted packet containing an extension field.

name: Pidgin 'msn_slplink_process_msg()' NULL Pointer Dereference Remote Code Execution
description: The msn_slplink_process_msg function in libpurple/protocols/msn/slplink.c in libpurple used in Pidgin allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code or cause a denial of service by sending multiple crafted SLP (aka MSNSLP) messages to trigger an overwrite of an arbitrary memory location.

name: FreeRADIUS RADIUS Server rad_decode Remote Denial Of Service
description: The rad_decode function in FreeRADIUS allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (radiusd crash) via zero-length Tunnel-Password attributes.

name: Windows Live Messenger Charset Data Remote Denial Of Service Vulnerability
description: Windows Live Messenger is prone to a remote denial of service vulnerability because it fails to handle instant messages with malformed 'Charset' data. An attacker can exploit this issue to crash the affected application, denying service to legitimate users.

name: HP LoadRunner XUpload.ocx ActiveX Control 'MakeHttpRequest()' Arbitrary File Download Vulnerability
description:
HP LoadRunner Persits.XUpload.2 ActiveX control is prone to a vulnerability that can allow attackers to download malicious files and save them to arbitrary locations on an affected computer.
Attackers may exploit this issue to execute malicious files within the context of the affected application that uses the affected control (typically Internet Explorer). Other attacks are also possible.

name: Oracle Document Capture BlackIceDEVMODE Arbitrary Command Execution
description:
A vulnerability has been discovered in Oracle Document Capture, which can be exploited by malicious people to potentially compromise a user's system.
The vulnerability is caused due to a design error in the BLACKICEDEVMODE.BlackIceDEVMODECtrl.1 ActiveX control (BlackIceDEVMODE.ocx). This can be exploited to set a custom application started with custom parameters for an existing printer, via calls to the "SetApplicationPath()" and "SetCustomStartAppParameter()" methods. Successful exploitation may allow execution of arbitrary commands when a document is printed using the altered printer.

name: KeyWorks KeyHelp ActiveX Remote BOF
description: KeyWorks KeyHelp ActiveX control is prone to a vulnerability that can allow attackers to execute remote code. Attackers may exploit this issue to execute malicious files within the context of the affected application that uses the affected control (typically Internet Explorer).

name: AOL SuperBuddy ActiveX Control SetSuperBuddy() Remote Code Execution
description: AOL SuperBuddy ActiveX control is prone to a vulnerability that can allow attackers to execute remote code. Attackers may exploit this issue to execute malicious files within the context of the affected application that uses the affected control (typically Internet Explorer).

name: SAP GUI WebViewer2D / WebViewer3D ActiveX Controls Insecure Methods
description: Some vulnerabilities have been reported in SAP GUI, which can be exploited by malicious people to overwrite arbitrary files.1) An error in the EAI WebViewer2D ActiveX control (WebViewer2D.dll) can be exploited to overwrite arbitrary files via specially crafted arguments passed to the SaveToSessionFile() method. 2) Two errors in the EAI WebViewer3D ActiveX control (WebViewer3D.dll) can be exploited to overwrite arbitrary files via specially crafted arguments passed to the SaveToSessionFile() and SaveViewToSessionFile() methods.

name: Acer LunchApp ActiveX Control Remote Code Execution Vulnerability
description: Acer LunchApp ActiveX Control is prone to a remote code-execution vulnerability. An attacker can exploit this issue to execute arbitrary code in the context of the application using the vulnerable ActiveX control (typically Internet Explorer).

name: Active Directory Invalid Free Vulnerability
description: A remote code execution vulnerability exists in implementations of Active Directory on Microsoft Windows 2000 Server. The vulnerability is due to incorrect freeing of memory when processing specially crafted LDAP or LDAPS requests. An attacker who successfully exploited this vulnerability could take complete control of an affected system.

name: Allow TFTP Client Traffic
description: This filter should be assigned in order to allow TFTP client traffic when stateful inspection is enabled.

name: CA BrightStor ARCserve Backup Message Engine Insecure Method Exposure
description:
The Message Engine RPC service in CA BrightStor ARCServe BackUp v9.01 through R11.5, and Enterprise Backup r10.5, allows attackers to execute arbitrary code by using certain "insecure method calls" to modify the file system and registry, aka "Privileged function exposure."

The filter could possibly block valid admin traffic and thus it has a user-definable list of IP addresses where it is possible to configure addresses of known admin servers.

name: COM Object Instantiation Memory Corruption - February 2009
description:
This filter sets killbits for the activex controls mentioned in the February 2009 security advisory from Microsoft.
http://www.microsoft.com/technet/security/advisory/960715.mspx

name: COM Object Instantiation Memory Corruption - July 2009
description:
This filter sets killbits for the activex control for the MPEG2TuneRequest object which is not designed to be used with Internet Explorer. Hence, a trigger should be investigated to determine if it is an attack or not.
http://www.microsoft.com/technet/security/advisory/972890.mspx

name: COM Object Instantiation Memory Corruption - June 2009
description: This filter sets killbits for the activex controls mentioned in the june 2009 security advisory of Microsoft.

name: Detected Too Many Outbound HTTP Requests With Cookie Header
description:
In certain race condition vulnerabilities an attacker can trigger a condition in the web browser that could allow a script to gain access to the content in another browser window in another domain or Internet Explorer zone. An attacker could exploit the vulnerability by constructing a specially crafted Web page that could allow information disclosure if a user viewed the Web page. This is also known as Cross-Domain Information Disclosure Vulnerability.

This filter detects too many web requests with cookie header which may be an indication of a race condition being exploited.

name: Disallow Web Proxy Autodiscovery Protocol
description: The Web Proxy Autodiscovery Protocol (WPAD) is a method used by web browsers, primarily Internet Explorer, to locate a proxy auto-config file automatically and use this to configure the browser's web proxy settings. This filter detects WPAD traffic in the network. It should not be applied if a trusted WPAD server is available in the network.

name: Enable TFTP Decoder
description: This filter should be assigned in order to enable TFTP decoder.

name: EXAMINE Command Argument Length Restriction
description: Restricts the length of the EXAMINE command's argument(s).

name: FTP MODE Command
description: Handles the FTP Mode Command. Limits it to 8 bytes, checks for format strings.

name: FTP USER Command
description: Check USER cmd for format strings.

name: Host Integration Server Command Execution Vulnerability
description: A remote code execution vulnerability exists in the SNA Remote Procedure Call (RPC) service for Host Integration Server. An attacker could exploit the vulnerability by constructing a specially crafted RPC request. The vulnerability could allow remote code execution. An attacker who successfully exploited this vulnerability could take complete control of an affected system.

name: Identified Suspicious Usage Of Shellcode Encoders For Client
description: Shellcode is a piece of machine code used as the payload in the exploitation of a software vulnerability. To evade detection or due to protocol constraints, shellcode is often encoded using various shellcode encoders. This filter will identify shellcode encoders that are typically used by automated exploitation tools such as Metasploit.

name: Imera Systems ImeraIEPlugin ActiveX Control Arbitrary File Download Vulnerability
description: A vulnerability has been identified in Imera ImeraIEPlugin ActiveX control, which can be exploited by remote attackers to compromise a vulnerable system. This issue is caused due to an error in the "ImeraIEPlugin.dll" control when processing the "DownloadHost" and "DownloadURI" properties, which can be exploited to download and execute arbitrary code by tricking a user into visiting a malicious web page.

name: Mass Hack Attack Malware JavaScript Redirection Domain Blocker 1
description: This filter blocks domains serving malicious .JS files which uses script to write an IFRAME, which in turn loads an HTML file that attempts to exploit several Script Insertion vulnerabilities.

name: Mass Hack Attack Malware JavaScript Redirection Domain Blocker 2
description: This filter blocks domains serving malicious .js files which uses script to write an IFRAME, which in turn loads an HTML file that attempts to exploit several Script Insertion vulnerabilities.

name: Mass Hack Attack Malware JavaScript Redirection Domain Blocker 3
description: This filter blocks domains serving malicious .js files which uses script to write an IFRAME, which in turn loads an HTML file that attempts to exploit several Script Insertion vulnerabilities.

name: Microsoft Internet Explorer And HTTP Services Authentication Reflection Code Execution
description:
An authentication reflection vulnerability exists in Microsoft Internet Explorer and Windows HTTP services. The flaw is due to a design weakness in the authentication challenge/response mechanism. Remote unauthenticated attackers can exploit this vulnerability by enticing a user to connect to a crafted HTTP server, and then connect back to the user's own SMB service utilizing the user's own challenge/response data. 

A successful exploitation can lead to arbitrary code execution within the security context of the affected user.

name: Microsoft Internet Explorer And HTTP Services Authentication Reflection Code Execution Helper Filter
description: This is a helper filter for "Microsoft Internet Explorer and HTTP Services Authentication Reflection Code Execution"

name: Microsoft Internet Explorer Restrict COM Object Instantiation
description: This filter restricts the instantiation of COM objects in Internet Explorer for which killbits are supposed to be set.

name: Microsoft Office Web Components Control Remote Code Execution
description:
Microsoft Office Web Components is prone to a remote code execution vulnerability that affects Office Web Components Spreadsheet ActiveX control. An attacker could exploit this issue by enticing a victim to visit a maliciously crafted site. Successfully exploiting this issue would allow the attacker to execute arbitrary code in the context of the currently logged-in user.

This filter sets killbits for the activex control for the OWC10 and OWC11 Spreadsheet objects. Hence, a trigger should be investigated to determine if it is an attack or not.
http://www.microsoft.com/technet/security/advisory/973472.mspx

name: Microsoft Windows 'MPEG2TuneRequest' Object Remote Code Execution Vulnerability
description:
Microsoft Windows is prone to a remote code-execution vulnerability that affects the TV Tuner library. An attacker could exploit this issue by enticing a victim to visit a maliciously crafted website. Successfully exploiting this issue would allow the attacker to execute arbitrary code in the context of the currently logged-in user.

This filter sets killbits for the activex control for the MPEG2TuneRequest object which is not designed to be used with Internet Explorer. Hence, a trigger should be investigated to determine if it is an attack or not.

name: Multiple Browser QuickTime Command Execution
description: Mozilla Firefox or Microsoft Internet Explorer when used with Quicktime can be used to remotely execute commands with chrome privileges.

name: Oracle Auditing DBMS_IJOB Security Bypass Vulnerability
description: A vulnerability in the Job Queue component in Oracle Database allows remote authenticated users to bypass Auditing via DBMS_IJOB package.

name: Oracle Database Application Express Component APEX Password Hash Disclosure
description: An information disclosure vulnerability exists in the Application Express component in Oracle Database server product. The vulnerability is due to an insecure design that allows remote authenticated attacker obtain access to password hashes via certain database views.

name: Restrict Download Of Files Using File:// Protocol
description:
This filter blocks files having the file:// protocol handler in the page contents from being downloaded. By default, latest versions of common browsers don't allow files to be accessed using file:// from the internet domain.
Note: If you want to allow files to be downloaded from the intranet domain containing file:// protocol handler, please make this filter detect only or disable it.

name: Restrict IE ActiveX Controls For MS08-070
description: A smart filter that blocks potential exploits of Visual Basic ActiveX control vulnerabilities that have been patched by the Microsoft bulletin MS08-070.

name: Restrict IMAP Commands Argument Length
description: Restricts the length of arguments to various IMAP commands.

name: Restrict Microsoft Agent ActiveX Control
description: This filter blocks the web pages trying to access Microsoft Agent ActiveX Control.

name: Restrict Microsoft Office Snapshot Viewer ActiveX Controls
description: The Microsoft Office Snapshot Viewer ActiveX control in snapview.ocx, as distributed in the standalone Snapshot Viewer and Microsoft Office Access 2000 through 2003, allows remote attackers to download arbitrary files to a client machine via a crafted HTML document or e-mail message.

name: Restrict Remote Computer Management
description: This filter identifies an attempt to administer a Windows host remotely. There are legitimate cases where administrators may need to do this but any alerts should be investigated.

name: Validate DHCP Hardware Type And Length
description: This filter restricts DHCP Hardware type to Ethernet and hardware length to the appropriate value for Ethernet networks.

name: Web Server Oracle APPLSYS.FND_DM_NODES Vulnerability
description: The APPLSYS.FND_DM_NODES package in Oracle E-Business Suite does not check for valid sessions, which allows remote attackers to delete arbitrary nodes.

name: VLC Media Player Multiple Remote Stack Buffer Overflow
description: VLC media player is prone to multiple stack-based buffer-overflow vulnerabilities. Attackers can exploit these issues to execute arbitrary code in the context of the affected application or crash the application, denying service to legitimate users.

name: Kaspersky 2010 Remote Memory Corruption DoS
description: A vulnerability exists in Kaspersky Internet Security and Antivirus which can result in high CPU usage thereby causing a denial of service.

name: EMC Captiva QuickScan Pro KeyHelp ActiveX Control Buffer Overflow
description: KeyWorks KeyHelp Module is prone to a remote stack-based buffer-overflow vulnerability because it fails to perform adequate boundary checks on user-supplied input. Attackers can leverage this issue to execute arbitrary code in the context of the application. Successful exploits will compromise the application and the computer. Failed attacks will cause denial-of-service conditions.

name: EMC Captiva PixTools Distributed Imaging ActiveX Control File Creation
description: The EMC Captiva PixTools Distributed Imaging ActiveX control is prone to multiple insecure-method vulnerabilities that affect the PDIControl.PDI.1 ActiveX control (PDIControl.dll). Successfully exploiting these issues allows remote attackers to create or overwrite arbitrary local files, which may lead to arbitrary code execution.

name: Black Ice Printer Driver Resource Toolkit ActiveX Control Remote Vulnerability
description: Black Ice Printer Driver Resource Toolkit ActiveX Control is prone to a buffer-overflow vulnerability and a remote command-execution vulnerability because the application fails to perform adequate boundary checks on user-supplied data. Successful exploits allow remote attackers to execute arbitrary code in the context of the application using the ActiveX control (typically Internet Explorer). Failed exploit attempts will likely result in denial-of-service conditions.

name: Mozilla Firefox Location Bar Visual Truncation Vulnerabilities
description: An error exists in Mozilla Firefox when displaying text in the location bar using the default Windows font. This can be exploited to spoof the URL of a trusted site via Unicode characters having a tall line-height.

name: VLC Media Player CUE File Buffer Overflow Vulnerability
description: VLC media player is prone to a buffer-overflow vulnerability because the WAV file decoder fails to perform adequate boundary checks on user supplied input. Attackers may leverage this issue to execute arbitrary code in the context of the application. Failed attacks can lead to denial-of-service conditions.

name: Windows Media Runtime Heap Corruption Vulnerability
description: A remote code execution vulnerability exists in the way that Microsoft Windows Media Runtime handles certain functions in compressed audio files. This vulnerability could allow remote code execution if a user opened a specially crafted file. If a user is logged on with administrative user rights, an attacker who successfully exploited this vulnerability could take complete control of an affected system.

name: HTML Component Handling Vulnerability
description: A remote code execution vulnerability exists in the way that Internet Explorer handles argument validation of a variable in specific situations. An attacker could exploit the vulnerability by constructing a specially crafted Web page. When a user views the Web page, the vulnerability could allow remote code execution. An attacker who successfully exploited this vulnerability could gain the same user rights as the logged-on user.

name: Memory Corruption In Indexing Service Vulnerability
description: A remote code execution vulnerability exists in the Indexing Service on Windows systems. The vulnerability is due to an ActiveX control included with the service not properly handling specifically crafted Web content. An attacker who successfully exploited this vulnerability could take complete control of an affected system.

name: WMP Heap Overflow Vulnerability
description: A remote code execution vulnerability exists in Windows Media Player. An attacker could exploit the vulnerability by constructing a specially crafted ASF file that could allow remote code execution when played using Windows Media Player. An attacker who successfully exploited this vulnerability could take complete control of an affected system.

name: ATL COM Initialization Vulnerability - ActiveX
description: A remote code execution vulnerability exists in the Microsoft ActiveX controls, which were compiled using the vulnerable Microsoft Active Template Library described in Microsoft Security Bulletin MS09-035. An attacker could exploit the vulnerability in these controls by constructing a specially crafted Web page. When a user views the Web page, the vulnerability could allow remote code execution. An attacker who successfully exploited this vulnerability could gain the same user rights as the logged on user.

name: Adobe Acrobat And Adobe Reader FlateDecode Integer Overflow
description: Integer overflow in Adobe Reader allows attackers to cause a denial of service or possibly execute arbitrary code via a PDF file containing unspecified parameters to the FlateDecode filter, which triggers a heap-based buffer overflow.

name: Detect deflate Content-Encoding In HTTP Traffic
description:
This filter detects deflate Content-Encoding in HTTP traffic.

Note: This filter may trigger for valid HTTP traffic.

name: Oracle Secure Backup Administration Server Authentication Bypass
description: Unspecified vulnerability in the Oracle Secure Backup component in Oracle Secure Backup allows remote attackers to affect confidentiality, integrity, and availability via unknown vectors.

name: IBM Informix Client SDK NFX File Processing Stack Buffer Overflow
description:
A code execution vulnerability has been reported to exist in IBM Informix Client SDK. The vulnerability is due to an stack buffer overflow when processing ".nfx" files which contain an overly long "HostList" entry.
In a successful attack scenario, where arbitrary code is injected and executed on the vulnerable target host, the behaviour of the target system is dependent on the malicious code. Note that any code executed by the attacker runs with the privileges of the logged in user.

name: Office BMP Integer Overflow Vulnerability
description: A remote code execution vulnerability exists in the way that Microsoft Office handles specially crafted Office Documents containing BMP images. The vulnerability could allow attackers to execute arbitrary code on the victim's machine by enticing the user to download a malformed bitmap file.

name: Novell eDirectory Buffer Overflow Vulnerability
description: Novell eDirectory is prone to a buffer-overflow vulnerability because it fails to perform adequate boundary checks on user-supplied data. Attackers can exploit this issue to execute arbitrary code in the context of the affected application. Failed exploit attempts will likely cause denial-of-service conditions.

name: Mozilla Firefox Browser Engine Denial Of Service
description: Multiple vulnerabilities have been identified in Mozilla Firefox, which could be exploited by attackers to manipulate or disclose certain data, bypass security restrictions or compromise a vulnerable system.

name: Mozilla Firefox document.getSelection() Cross-origin Data Theft Vulnerability
description: Mozilla Firefox is prone to a security theft vulnerability, the text within a selection on a web page can be read by JavaScript in a different domain using the document.getSelection function, violating the same-origin policy.

name: Mozilla Firefox liboggplay Denial Of Service
description: Multiple memory safety vulnerabilities have been reported in third party libraries used by Mozilla Firefox. Specifically, the liboggz, libvorbis, and liboggplay libraries are affected. These errors may be exploited by remote unauthenticated attackers to execute arbitrary code on the target user's machine within the security context of the logged in user.

name: Oracle Database Server CREATE_TABLES SQL Injection
description: Unspecified vulnerability in the Oracle Text component in Oracle Database allows remote authenticated users to affect confidentiality and integrity, related to CTXSYS.DRVXTABC.

name: IBM Lotus Notes RSS Reader Widget HTML Injection Vulnerability
description: IBM Lotus Notes is prone to an HTML-injection vulnerability because the application fails to properly sanitize user-supplied input before using it in dynamically generated content. Attacker-supplied HTML and script code would run in the context of the affected browser, potentially allowing the attacker to steal cookie-based authentication credentials or to control how the site is rendered to the user.

name: Mozilla Firefox Download Filename Spoofing Vulnerability
description: Mozilla Firefox is prone to a download filename spoofing vulnerability. An attacker could use this vulnerability to obfuscate the name and file extension of a file to be downloaded and opened, potentially causing a user to run an executable file when they expected to open a non-executable file.

name: Adobe ColdFusion Multiple HTML Injection Vulnerabilities
description: Multiple cross-site scripting (XSS) vulnerabilities in Adobe ColdFusion Server allows remote attackers to inject arbitrary web script or HTML via (1) the startRow parameter to administrator/logviewer/searchlog.cfm, or the query string to (2) wizards/common/_logintowizard.cfm, (3) wizards/common/_authenticatewizarduser.cfm, or (4) administrator/enter.cfm.

name: Adobe Reader And Acrobat COM Objects Memory Corruption Remote Code Execution Vulnerability
description: Adobe Reader and Acrobat are prone to a remote code-execution vulnerability because they fail to properly handle certain COM objects. An attacker can exploit this issue by supplying a malicious PDF file or webpage. Successful exploits may allow the attacker to execute arbitrary code in the context of a user running the affected application. Failed attempts will likely result in denial-of-service conditions.

name: Symantec Altiris Products ActiveX Control Buffer Overflow
description: Symantec Altiris Notification Server with Symantec Management Platform and Altiris Deployment Solution are prone to a buffer-overflow vulnerability because the applications use an ActiveX control provided by 'AeXNSConsoleUtilities.dll' that fails to properly validate user-supplied input. An attacker can exploit this issue to execute arbitrary code in the context of the application using the ActiveX control.

name: Adobe Acrobat Reader Remote Code Execution Vulnerability
description: Heap-based buffer overflow in Adobe Reader and Acrobat allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code via a crafted PDF file that triggers memory corruption.

name: VMware Authorization Service Format String Denial Of Service
description: VMware Player and Workstation are prone to a remote denial-of-service vulnerability because the applications fail to perform adequate validation checks on user-supplied input. An attacker can exploit this issue to crash the 'vmware-authd' process, denying service to legitimate users.

name: Ipswitch IMail Server IMAP Stack Buffer Overflow
description: Multiple buffer overflows in Ipswitch IMail allow remote attackers or authenticated users to execute arbitrary code via (1) the authentication feature in IMailsec.dll, which triggers heap corruption in the IMail Server, or (2) a long SUBSCRIBE IMAP command, which triggers a stack-based buffer overflow in the IMAP Daemon.

name: LSASS Recursive Stack Overflow Vulnerability
description: A denial of service vulnerability exists in implementations of Active Directory on Microsoft Windows 2000 Server, Windows Server 2003, and Windows Server 2008. The vulnerability also exists in implementations of Active Directory Application Mode (ADAM) when installed on Windows XP and Windows Server 2003, and Active Directory Lightweight Directory Service (AD LDS) on Windows Server 2008. The vulnerability is due to stack space exhaustion during execution of certain types of LDAP or LDAPS requests. An attacker who successfully exploited this vulnerability could cause the affected system to stop responding.

name: Excel Field Sanitization Vulnerability
description: A remote code execution vulnerability exists in Microsoft Office Excel that could allow remote code execution if a user opens a specially crafted Excel file that includes a malformed record object. An attacker who successfully exploited this vulnerability could take complete control of an affected system.

name: Win FTP Server 'LIST' FTP Command Remote Buffer Overflow Vulnerability
description:
Win FTP Server is prone to a remote buffer-overflow vulnerability.
An attacker can exploit this issue to execute arbitrary code within the context of the affected application. Failed exploit attempts will result in a denial-of-service condition.

name: RealNetworks Helix Server RTSP SETUP Request Denial Of Service
description: RealNetworks Helix Server is prone to a  denial of service vulnerability, which is due to an error in the way Helix Server handles SETUP requests. Remote unauthenticated attackers can exploit this flaw by sending a crafted SETUP request to an affected server.

name: Web Services On Devices API Memory Corruption Vulnerability
description: A remote code execution vulnerability exists in the Web Services on Devices API (WSDAPI) on Windows systems. The vulnerability is due to the service not properly handling a WSDAPI message with a specially crafted header. An attacker who successfully exploited this vulnerability could take complete control of an affected system.

name: OpenH323 Opal SIP Protocol Remote Denial Of Service Vulnerability
description: The Open Phone Abstraction Library (opal), as used by (1) Ekiga before (2) OpenH323, allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (crash) via an invalid Content-Length header field in Session Initiation Protocol (SIP) packets.

name: Adobe Reader And Acrobat XMP-XML Entity Expansion Denial Of Service Vulnerability
description: Adobe Reader do not properly perform XMP-XML entity expansion, which allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service via a crafted document.

name: Microsoft Office Word File Information Memory Corruption Vulnerability
description: A remote code execution vulnerability exists in the way that Microsoft Office Word handles a specially crafted Word file that includes a malformed record. An attacker who successfully exploited this vulnerability could take complete control of an affected system.

name: Excel Index Parsing Vulnerability
description: A remote code execution vulnerability exists in Microsoft Office Excel as a result of pointer corruption when loading Excel formulas. The vulnerability could allow remote code execution if a user opens a specially crafted Excel file that includes a malformed formula. An attacker who successfully exploited this vulnerability could take complete control of an affected system.

name: Mod_NTLM Authorization Heap Overflow Vulnerability
description:
Two vulnerabilities have been identified in "mod_ntlm", which is a module available for the Apache web server.

Both vulnerabilities exist in the function "log()" and are caused due to a boundary error and a format string error. A malicious person can exploit the vulnerabilities by either supplying format specifiers or about 2048 bytes of specially crafted data in the "Authorization:" header. 

Successful exploitation can result in execution of arbitrary code on the vulnerable system with the privileges of the web server.

name: HP OpenView Network Node Manager 'ovdbrun.exe' Denial Of Service Vulnerability
description: There exists a remotely exploitable vulnerability in the database server core component used by NNM. Exploitation of the bug does not require authentication and will lead to a remotely triggered denial of service of the internal database service.

name: IBM Tivoli Storage Manager Client CAD Service Buffer Overflow
description: Stack-based buffer overflow in the client acceptor daemon (CAD) scheduler in the client in IBM Tivoli Storage Manager (TSM), allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code via crafted data in a TCP packet.

name: Symantec Multiple Products AeXNSConsoleUtilities Buffer Overflow
description: Buffer overflow in the RunCmd method in the Altiris eXpress NS Console Utilities ActiveX control in AeXNSConsoleUtilities.dll in the web console in Symantec Altiris Deployment Solution, Altiris Notification Server, and Management Platform allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code via a long string in the second argument.

name: ClamAV 'cli_check_jpeg_exploit' Function Malformed JPEG File Remote DoS
description: ClamAV is prone to a denial-of-service vulnerability. Attackers can exploit this issue to cause denial-of-service conditions. Given the nature of this issue, attackers may also be able to run arbitrary code, but this has not been confirmed.

name: Trillian URI Handler Remote Code Execution Vulnerability
description: Trillian is prone to remote command and code execution vulnerabilities because the application fails to properly handle user-supplied input via a registered URI. Successfully exploiting these issues allows attackers to execute arbitrary commands or code in the context of the affected application.

name: Sun MySQL Database PROCEDURE ANALYSE Denial Of Service
description: A denial of service vulnerability has been reported in MySQL database server. The vulnerability is due to an input validation error while parsing a specially crafted query containing a view using temporary tables and PROCEDURE ANALYSE. Remote authenticated users can exploit this vulnerability to cause a denial of service condition. Successful exploitation would cause the database service to terminate abnormally.

name: HP Power Manager Remote Code Execution
description: A remote code execution vulnerability exists within HP Power Manager. The vulnerability is due to insufficient bounds checking in the HP Power Manager while processing URL parameters in the login form of the web based management web server. Remote unauthenticated attackers can exploit this vulnerability by sending malicious HTTP requests to the target.

name: Detected HTTP Server Traffic
description:
This is a heuristics based filter to detect HTTP Server traffic on a host. By default, any HTTP Sever traffic identified on TCP ports other than the commonly used 80 and 8080 will trigger this filter. Rogue HTTP servers may indicate policy violations or presence of malicious software on the computer.

This filter will only trigger once per 24 hours for a given host to prevent excessive logging. The monitored ports and frequency of event settings can be modified on the Configuration tab should your environment require different configuration.

name: Detected HTTP Traffic Over Secured HTTPS Channels
description:
This is a heuristics based filter to detect unsecured HTTP Server traffic on specified secured channels where encryption should be used for all  connections. By default, HTTPS traffic is commonly used on port 443. Rogue HTTP servers may indicate policy violations or presence of malicious software on the computer.

Administrators are recommended to apply this filter to all ports that use HTTPS for encrypted communication.

name: Detected MSSQL Server Traffic
description: This filter detects Database MSSQL server traffic based on heuristics. Configuration options are provided to set the event frequency of this filter.

name: Detected SMTP Server Traffic
description: This filter detects SMTP server traffic based on heuristics. Configuration options are provided to set the event frequency of this filter.

name: Citrix XenCenterWeb Multiple Input Validation Vulnerabilities
description: Citrix XenCenterWeb is vulnerable to cross-site scripting, caused by improper validation of user-supplied input. A remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability using a specially-crafted URL to execute script in a victim's Web browser within the security context of the hosting Web site, once the URL is clicked. An attacker could use this vulnerability to steal the victim's cookie-based authentication credentials.

name: Sun MySQL Database SELECT Subquery Denial Of Service
description: A denial of service vulnerability has been reported in MySQL database server. The vulnerability is due to an input validation error while parsing a specially crafted SELECT query with a sub-query in the WHERE clause. Remote authenticated users can exploit this vulnerability to cause a denial of service condition. Successful exploitation would cause the database service to terminate abnormally.

name: Digium Asterisk SIP sscanf Multiple Denial Of Service Vulnerabilities
description: A denial of service vulnerability exists in Asterisk SIP Channel Driver. The vulnerability is caused due to insufficient input validation when processing maliciously crafted SIP requests. Remote authenticated attackers could exploit this vulnerability by sending a crafted SIP request containing excessively long numeric strings.

name: Adobe Browser Document ActiveX Denial Of Service
description: Adobe Acrobat is prone to a remote denial-of-service vulnerability when supplied with a malformed URL. This issue can allow remote attackers to crash the application denying further service to legitimate users.

name: Remote Code Execution In ADFS Vulnerability
description: A remote code execution vulnerability exists in implementations of Active Directory Federation Services (ADFS). The vulnerability is due to incorrect validation of request headers when an authenticated user connects to an ADFS enabled Web server. An attacker who successfully exploited this vulnerability could take complete control of an affected system.

name: MS-CHAP Authentication Bypass Vulnerability
description: An elevation of privilege vulnerability exists in the Internet Authentication Service. An attacker who sends a maliciously crafted Microsoft Challenge Handshake Authentication Protocol version 2 (MS-CHAP v2) authentication request could obtain access to network resources under the privileges of a specific authorized user.

name: WordPad And Office Text Converter Memory Corruption
description: A remote code execution vulnerability exists in the way that text converters in Microsoft WordPad and Microsoft Office Word process memory when a user opens a specially crafted Word 97 file.

name: Microsoft Project Memory Validation Vulnerability
description: A remote code execution vulnerability exists in the way that Microsoft Office Project handles specially crafted Project files. An attacker who successfully exploited this vulnerability could take complete control of an affected system.

name: Microsoft Office Excel Record Integer Overflow Vulnerability
description: A remote code execution vulnerability exists in Microsoft Office Excel that could allow remote code execution if a user opens a specially crafted Excel file that includes a malformed record object. An attacker who successfully exploited this vulnerability could take complete control of an affected system.

name: HP OpenView Network Node Manager 'ovdbrun.exe' DoS Vulnerability
description: There exists a remotely exploitable vulnerability in the database server core component used by NNM. Exploitation of the bug does not require authentication and will lead to a remotely triggered denial of service of the internal database service.

name: VLC Media Player RTSP Remote Buffer Overflow
description: VLC Media Player is prone to a remote heap-based buffer-overflow vulnerability because the application fails to perform adequate boundary checks on user-supplied data. Exploiting this issue allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary machine code in the context of the affected application. Failed exploit attempts will result in a denial-of-service condition.

name: Internet Explorer Uninitialized Memory Corruption Remote Code Execution Vulnerability
description: A remote code execution vulnerability exists in the way that Internet Explorer accesses an object that has not been correctly initialized or has been deleted. An attacker could exploit the vulnerability by constructing a specially crafted Web page. When a user views the Web page, the vulnerability could allow remote code execution. An attacker who successfully exploited this vulnerability could gain the same user rights as the logged-on user.

name: Microsoft Excel Indexing Validation Vulnerability
description: A remote code execution vulnerability exists in the way Excel processes an array index when loading Excel files into memory. An attacker could exploit the vulnerability by opening a specially crafted file which could be hosted on a Web site, or included as an e-mail attachment.

name: Microsoft Excel SxView Memory Corruption Vulnerability
description: A remote code execution vulnerability exists in the way Microsoft Office Excel handles specially crafted Excel files that include a malformed record object. An attacker who successfully exploited this vulnerability could take complete control of an affected system.

name: Oracle Document Capture EasyMail IMAP4 LicenseKey Buffer Overflow
description: A stack-based buffer overflow vulnerability exists in Oracle Document Capture which is integrated with Oracle Imaging and Process Management and Oracle Universal Content Management products. The vulnerability is due to a boundary error while parsing the LicenseKey property within the  EasyMail IMAP4 ActiveX component of the affected product.

name: Adobe Illustrator Encapsulated Postscript File Remote Buffer Overflow
description: Adobe Illustrator is prone to a remote buffer-overflow vulnerability because it fails to perform adequate boundary checks on user-supplied data. An attacker can exploit this issue by enticing an unsuspecting victim to open a malicious Encapsulated PostScript file. Successfully exploiting this issue will allow attackers to execute arbitrary code with the privileges of the user running the affected application. Failed exploit attempts will likely result in a denial-of-service condition.

name: Novell eDirectory HTTP GET Request Unicode Strings Denial Of Service Vulnerability
description: Novell eDirectory is prone to a denial-of-service vulnerability. Remote attackers can exploit this issue to consume an excessive amount of resources, denying service to legitimate users.

name: Sun Java Runtime Environment JPEGImageReader Heap Overflow
description: A heap overflow vulnerability exists in Sun Java Runtime Environment. The vulnerability is due to an integer overflow that can occur when processing malicious JPEG image dimensions. Remote unauthenticated attackers can exploit this vulnerability by enticing the user to visit a malicious web page.

name: EMC RepliStor rep_srv And ctrlservice Denial Of Service
description: A denial of service vulnerability exists in EMC RepliStor. The vulnerability is due to an input validation error while parsing a specially crafted packet. Remote unauthenticated attackers can exploit this vulnerability by sending a malicious packet. Successful exploitation of this vulnerability would abnormally terminate the targeted service and cause a denial of service condition.

name: Mozilla Firefox GeckoActiveXObject Exception Message COM Object Enumeration Vulnerability
description: Mozilla Firefox is prone to a COM object enumeration vulnerability. An attacker can exploit this issue by enticing an unsuspecting victim to view a malicious webpage. Successful exploits will allow attackers to enumerate a list of COM objects installed on the affected computer and create a profile to track the user over browsing sessions.

name: MySQL Multiple Remote Denial Of Service Vulnerabilities
description: mysqld in MySQL does not (1) properly handle errors during execution of certain SELECT statements with subqueries, and does not (2) preserve certain null_value flags during execution of statements that use the GeomFromWKB function, which allows remote authenticated users to cause a denial of service (daemon crash) via a crafted statement.

name: Mozilla Firefox 'libpr0n' GIF File Handling Denial Of Service Vulnerability
description: The nsGIFDecoder2::GifWrite function in decoders/gif/nsGIFDecoder2.cpp in libpr0n in Mozilla Firefox allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (NULL pointer dereference and application crash) via an animated GIF file with a large image size.

name: Digium Asterisk RTP Comfort Noise Frame Processing Denial Of Service
description: A denial of service vulnerability has been reported in Asterisk. The vulnerability is caused due to an error in the handling of RTP comfort noise payloads. This can be exploited to cause a crash by sending a maliciously crafted RTP comfort noise payload.

name: Multiple Vendors NTP Mode 7 Denial Of Service
description: A denial of service vulnerability exists in NTP. ntp_request.c in ntpd, allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service by using MODE_PRIVATE to send a spoofed (1) request or (2) response packet that triggers a continuous exchange of MODE_PRIVATE error responses between two NTP daemons.

name: Hewlett-Packard OpenView NNM nnmRptConfig.exe Template Variable strcat Overflow Vulnerability
description:
Multiple stack-based buffer overflows in HP OpenView Network Node Manager (OV NNM) allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code via  a long Template parameter to nnmRptConfig.exe, related to the strcat and vsprintf functions.


This vulnerability was shared with Trend Micro in advance of public disclosure by TippingPoint through its Zero Day Initiative (http://www.zerodayinitiative.com).

name: Sun Java Runtime AWT setDifflCM Stack Buffer Overflow
description: A buffer overflow vulnerability exists in Sun's Java Runtime Environment. Specifically, the vulnerability is due to a flaw that exists in the processing of arguments to the setDiffICM AWT library function. Due to the lack of bounds checking on one of the parameters to the function, a stack buffer overflow can occur. This error may be exploited by remote unauthenticated attackers to execute arbitrary code on the target system by enticing the user to visit a malicious web page.

name: Apple Safari Webkit Floating Point Buffer Overflow
description: Buffer overflow in WebKit in Apple Safari before 4.0.3 allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code or cause a denial of service (application crash) via crafted floating-point numbers.

name: VideoLAN VLC Media Player SMB URI Invalid Free Vulnerability
description: A memory corruption vulnerability exists in VideoLAN VLC media player which is caused due to an invalid free error when processing SMB URIs. Remote attackers can exploit this vulnerability by enticing target users to open a maliciously crafted playlist file in a vulnerable version of VideoLAN VLC media player.

name: Persits Software XUpload 'AddFile()' Method ActiveX Control Remote Buffer Overflow
description: XUpload is prone to a buffer-overflow vulnerability because it fails to perform adequate boundary checks on user-supplied input. An attacker may exploit this issue to execute arbitrary code in the context of an application using the ActiveX control. Failed attacks will likely cause denial-of-service conditions.

name: Microsoft ASN.1 Library Bitstring Heap Overflow (worm attack)
description: The vulnerability exists in the MSASN1 library. This library is used by many programs, which require the ability to decode or encode ASN.1 objects. The library is located at [%SystemRoot%\system32\msasn1.dll]. The following shared libraries are known to use msasn1.dll: crypt32.dll, kerberos.dll, lsasrv.dll and inetcomm.dll.

name: MS06-008 Web Client Service Vulnerability
description: A remote code execution vulnerability exists in the way that Windows processes Web Client requests that could allow an attacker who successfully exploited this vulnerable to take complete control of the affected system.

name: Symantec Multiple Products VRTSweb Code Execution
description: VRTSweb.exe in VRTSweb does not properly validate authentication requests, which allows remote attackers to trigger the unpacking of a WAR archive, and execute arbitrary code in the contained files, via crafted data.

name: Novell eDirectory '/dhost/httpstk;submit' Stack Buffer Overflow
description: Novell eDirectory is prone to multiple stack-based buffer-overflow vulnerabilities because it fails to perform adequate boundary checks on user-supplied data. Attackers can exploit these issues to execute arbitrary code in the context of the affected application. Failed exploit attempts will likely cause denial-of-service conditions.

name: Yahoo! Messenger 'YahooBridgeLib.dll' ActiveX Control Remote Denial Of Service Vulnerability
description:
Yahoo! Messenger is prone to a denial-of-service vulnerability because of a NULL-pointer dereference error.
A successful attack allows a remote attacker to crash the application using the ActiveX control (typically Internet Explorer), denying further service to legitimate users. Given the nature of this issue, the attacker may also be able to run arbitrary code, but this has not been confirmed.

name: Kerberos KDC Cross-Realm Referral Denial Of Service Vulnerability
description: The prep_reprocess_req function in kdc/do_tgs_req.c in the cross-realm referral implementation in the Key Distribution Center (KDC) in MIT Kerberos 5  allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (NULL pointer dereference and daemon crash) via a ticket request.

name: Multiple Browser Certificate Regexp Parsing Heap Overflow
description: Heap-based buffer overflow in a regular-expression parser in Network Security Services (NSS) as used in multiple browsers allows remote SSL servers to cause a denial of service (application crash) or possibly execute arbitrary code via a long domain name in the subject's Common Name (CN) field of an X.509 certificate, related to the cert_TestHostName function.

name: RealNetworks RealPlayer '.rm' File Malformed URI Remote Denial Of Service Vulnerability
description: RealNetworks RealPlayer is prone to a remote denial-of-service vulnerability because the application fails to handle specially crafted files. Exploiting this issue allows remote attackers to crash the application, denying further service to legitimate users.

name: Trend Micro Web-Deployment ActiveX Remote Execution
description: An ActiveX vulnerability exists in the Trend Micro Web-Deployment. Exploiting this vulnerability may cause remote code execution on the victim's system.

name: Novell eDirectory 8.7.3 Multiple Unspecified Vulnerabilities
description: Novell eDirectory is prone to multiple remote vulnerabilities. An attacker can leverage these issues to execute arbitrary code within the context of the vulnerable application and obtain potentially sensitive information.

name: Gracenote CDDBControl ActiveX Control 'ViewProfile' Method Heap Buffer Overflow Vulnerability
description: Gracenote CDDBControl is prone to a stack-based buffer-overflow vulnerability because the application fails to adequately check boundaries on user-supplied input. An attacker can exploit this issue to execute arbitrary code in the context of the application using the ActiveX control (typically Internet Explorer). Failed attacks will likely cause denial-of-service conditions.

name: Adobe Flash Player SWF File Denial Of Service Vulnerability
description: Adobe Flash Player is prone to a remote denial-of-service vulnerability that arises when the application is used with Internet Explorer. Successful exploits will allow attackers to crash the browser, denying service to legitimate users.

name: Novell eDirectory NDS Verb 0x1 Request Integer Overflow Vulnerability
description: Integer overflow in Novell eDirectory allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code via an NDS Verb 0x1 request containing a large integer value that triggers a heap-based buffer overflow.

name: LibTIFF 'LZWDecodeCompat()' Remote Buffer Underflow Vulnerability
description: Buffer underflow in the LZWDecodeCompat function in libtiff allows context-dependent attackers to cause a denial of service (crash) via a crafted TIFF image, a different vulnerability than CVE-2008-2327.

name: Adobe Reader And Acrobat Forms Data Format Remote Security Bypass Vulnerability
description: The default configuration of Adobe Reader and Acrobat on Windows does not properly support the Enhanced Security feature, which has unspecified impact and attack vectors, related to a "script injection vulnerability."

name: Microsoft Internet Explorer Null Pointer Dereference Denial Of Service Vulnerabilities
description: Microsoft Internet Explorer is prone to two remote denial-of-service vulnerabilities. Successful exploits can allow attackers to crash the affected browser, resulting in denial-of-service conditions.

name: IBM Lotus Domino Buffer Overflow Vulnerability
description: A vulnerability has been reported in IBM Lotus Domino, which can be exploited by malicious people to cause a DoS (Denial of Service) and potentially compromise a vulnerable system.The vulnerability is caused due to an error in the processing of LDAP messages, which can be exploited to cause a heap-based buffer overflow via a specially crafted LDAP message.

name: Adobe Download Manager getPlus ActiveX Control Buffer Overflow
description: Buffer overflow in the Download Manager in Adobe Reader and Acrobat on Windows might allow attackers to execute arbitrary code via unspecified vectors.

name: Microsoft IE Uninitialized Memory Corruption Remote Code Execution
description: A remote code execution vulnerability exists in the way that Internet Explorer accesses an object that has not been correctly initialized or has been deleted. An attacker could exploit the vulnerability by constructing a specially crafted Web page. When a user views the Web page, the vulnerability could allow remote code execution. An attacker who successfully exploited this vulnerability could gain the same user rights as the logged-on user.

name: Sun Java System Directory Server 'core_get_proxyauth_dn' Denial Of Service
description: Sun Java System Directory Server is prone to a denial-of-service vulnerability. An attacker can exploit this issue to crash the affected application, denying service to legitimate users.

name: Apple Safari Stylesheet Redirection Information Disclosure
description: Apple Safari allows remote attackers to discover a redirect's target URL, for the session of a specific user of a web site, by placing the site's URL in the HREF attribute of a stylesheet LINK element, and then reading the document.styleSheets[0].href property value.

name: Requests Can Cause Directory Listing To Be Displayed
description: Oracle HTTP Server on Windows servers allows remote attackers to bypass the default index page and list directory contents via crafted HTTP requests.

name: IBM SolidDB 'solid.exe' Denial Of Service Vulnerability
description: IBM SolidDB is prone to a remote denial-of-service vulnerability. An attacker may leverage this issue to crash the affected application, denying service to affected users.

name: Microsoft Windows Defender ActiveX Heap Overflow
description: Microsoft Windows Defender ActiveX control is prone to a heap based buffer overflow vulnerability because the application fails to adequately check boundaries on user supplied input. An attacker can exploit this issue to execute arbitrary code in the context of the application using the ActiveX control.

name: Windows Live Messenger ActiveX Control 'RichUploadControlContextData' Buffer Overflow Vulnerability
description: Windows Live Messenger is prone to a buffer-overflow vulnerability because the application fails to perform adequate boundary checks on user-supplied data. Successful exploits allow remote attackers to execute arbitrary code in the context of the application using the ActiveX control (typically Internet Explorer). Failed exploit attempts will likely result in denial-of-service conditions.

name: Sun Java System Web Server 7.0u7 TRACE Overflow
description: There is a vulnerability in sun java system web server. Attacker can exploit this issue by sending a malformed TRACE request it is possible to overwrite heap and leak portions of server's memory.

name: Firefox XML Parser Memory Corruption Denial Of Service
description: There exists a denial of service (memory corruption) in Firefox caused due to crafted XML document composed of a long series of start-tags with no corresponding end-tags.

name: Pidgin MSN File Download Vulnerability
description: The MSN protocol plugin extracts the file name of a custom emoticon from an incoming request and uploads that file without correlating the file name to a valid custom emoticon. This could allow a remote attacker to download arbitrary files from a libpurple-based client.

name: Oracle Database Remote Listener Memory Corruption Vulnerability
description: Unspecified vulnerability in the Listener component in Oracle Database allows remote attackers to affect confidentiality, integrity, and availability via unknown vectors.

name: MS IE Uninitialized Memory Corruption Vulnerability
description: A remote code execution vulnerability exists in the way that Internet Explorer accesses an object that has not been correctly initialized or has been deleted. An attacker could exploit the vulnerability by constructing a specially crafted Web page. When a user views the Web page, the vulnerability could allow remote code execution. An attacker who successfully exploited this vulnerability could gain the same user rights as the logged-on user.

name: OpenOffice '.slk' File NULL Pointer Dereference Remote Denial Of Service Vulnerability
description: OpenOffice is prone to a remote denial-of-service vulnerability caused by a NULL-pointer dereference.Attackers can exploit this issue by enticing an unsuspecting victim to open a specially crafted '.slk' file.Successful exploits will cause the application to crash, denying service to legitimate users. Given the nature of this issue, attackers may also be able to run arbitrary code, but this has not been confirmed.

name: Opera Web Browser 'dtoa()' Remote Code Execution Vulnerability
description: Array index error in the dtoa implementation in dtoa.c (aka pdtoa.c) in libc,  allows context-dependent attackers to cause a denial of service (application crash) and possibly execute arbitrary code via a large precision value in the format argument to a printf function, which triggers incorrect memory allocation and a heap-based buffer overflow during conversion to a floating-point number.

name: VLC Media Player ASS File Buffer Overflow Vulnerability
description: VLC media player is prone to a buffer-overflow vulnerability because the Aegisub Advanced SubStation ('.ass') file handler fails to perform adequate boundary checks on user-supplied input. Attackers may leverage this issue to execute arbitrary code in the context of the application. Failed attacks will cause denial-of-service conditions.

name: Apache mod_proxy HTTP Chunked Encoding Integer Overflow
description: Apache is prone to a remote integer-overflow vulnerability. An attacker can exploit this issue to execute arbitrary code. Successful exploits will compromise affected computers. Failed exploit attempts will result in a denial-of-service condition.

name: Mozilla Firefox Content Injection Spoofing Vulnerability
description: Mozilla Firefox allows remote attackers to associate spoofed content with an invalid URL by setting document.location to this URL, and then writing arbitrary web script or HTML to the associated blank document.

name: AOL 9.5 ActiveX Heap Overflow Vulnerability
description: There is a vulnerability in Activex Control of AOL. Successful exploitation allow remote attackers to execute arbitrary code.

name: Ingres 9.3 Heap Overflow
description: There exists a heap overflow vulnerability in Ingres Database. This vulnerability can be exploited by malicious users to execute arbitrary code on the affected system.

name: RealNetworks RealPlayer IVR Format Remote Code Execution Vulnerability
description:
Heap-based buffer overflow in a DLL file in RealNetworks RealPlayer, RealPlayer Enterprise, Linux RealPlayer and Helix Player allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code via a crafted Internet Video Recording (IVR) file with a modified field that controls an unspecified structure length and triggers heap corruption, related to use of RealPlayer through a Windows Explorer plugin.

Note: This vulnerability was shared with Trend Micro in advance of public disclosure by TippingPoint through its Zero Day Initiative (http://www.zerodayinitiative.com).

name: Multiple Media Player HTTP DataHandler Overflow
description: A memory corruption vulnerability exists in multiple media players including Apple Quicktime, iTunes, Media Player Classic as they do not properly parse .mov files. An attack could exploit the vulnerability by uploading a malicious .mov file and possibly execute arbitrary code on the victim's machine by enticing the victim to open the malicious file.

name: Microsoft Internet Explorer URI Redirection Security Bypass
description: Microsoft Internet Explorer does not prevent rendering of non-HTML local files as HTML documents, which allows remote attackers to bypass intended access restrictions and read arbitrary files via vectors involving JavaScript exploit code that constructs a reference to a file://127.0.0.1 URL.

name: Oracle WebLogic Server Node Manager 'beasvc.exe' Remote Command Execution Vulnerability
description:
Oracle WebLogic Server is prone to a remote command-execution vulnerability because the software fails to restrict access to sensitive commands. Successful attacks can compromise the affected software and possibly the computer.

Note: This DPI rule requires the server certificate to be imported in the Deep Security Manager so that the Deep Security Agents where this rule is applied can decrypt the traffic on the network and inspect it for malicious activity.

name: Cumulative Security Update of ActiveX Kill Bits - February 2010
description: This filter sets killbits for the activex controls mentioned in the February 2010 security advisory of Microsoft.

name: MSO.DLL Buffer Overflow
description: A remote code execution vulnerability exists in the way Microsoft Office handles specially crafted Office files. An attacker who successfully exploited this vulnerability could take complete control of an affected system.

name: Novell iManager eDirectory Plugin Schema Buffer Overflow
description: Stack-based buffer overflow in the eDirectory plugin in Novell iManager allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code via vectors that trigger long arguments to an unspecified sub-application, related to importing and exporting from a schema.

name: Oracle 11gR2 Remote Command Execution Vulnerability
description:
Oracle Database is prone to a remote command-execution vulnerability.
An attacker can exploit this issue to execute arbitrary operating system commands with SYSTEM privileges, leading to a complete compromise of an affected computer.

name: Microsoft Messenger Information Disclosure Vulnerability
description: An information disclosure vulnerability exists in supported versions of Windows Messenger. Scripting of a particular ActiveX control, Messenger.UIAutomation.1, could allow information disclosure from these programs in the context of the logged-on user. An attacker could change state, get contact information, and initiate audio and video chat sessions without the knowledge of the logged-on user. An attacker could also capture the users logon ID and remotely log on to the uses Messenger client as that user.

name: MySQL yassl Stack Overflow
description: MySQL compiled with yaSSL is prone to a remote stack based buffer overflow vulnerability because the application fails to perform adequate boundary checks on user-supplied data. Attackers can exploit this issue to execute arbitrary code within the context of the affected application.

name: PowerPoint LinkedSlideAtom Heap Overflow Vulnerability
description: A remote code execution vulnerability exists in the way that Microsoft Office PowerPoint handles specially crafted PowerPoint files. An attacker who successfully exploited this vulnerability could take complete control of an affected system.

name: RealNetworks RealPlayer SMIL getAtom Remote Code Execution Vulnerability
description:
Heap-based buffer overflow in smlrender.dll in RealNetworks RealPlayer and Helix Player allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code via an SMIL file with crafted string lengths.

Note: This vulnerability was shared with Trend Micro in advance of public disclosure by TippingPoint through its Zero Day Initiative (http://www.zerodayinitiative.com).

name: AOLServer Terminal Escape Sequence In Logs Command Injection Vulnerability
description: AOLServer is prone to a command-injection vulnerability because it fails to adequately sanitize user-supplied input in logfiles. Attackers can exploit this issue to execute arbitrary commands in a terminal.

name: Mozilla Firefox Remote Denial Of Service
description: Mozilla Firefox is prone to a denial-of-service vulnerability when parsing marquee tags. Successfully exploiting this issue allows attackers to consume excessive CPU resources in affected browsers, denying service to legitimate users.

name: Oracle TimesTen timestend DoS
description: A Denial Of Service vulnerability exists in Oracle TimesTen.

name: Microsoft PowerPoint Malformed Data Record Code Execution
description: There exists a memory corruption vulnerability in Microsoft PowerPoint. The flaw is caused by incorrect processing of non-container records contained within a PowerPoint file. An attacker can exploit this vulnerability to inject and execute arbitrary code in the security context of the currently logged in user.

name: Restrict Access To Oracle DBMS_JAVA.RUNJAVA And DBMS_JAVA_TEST.FUNCALL Functions
description:
