Oracle Database is prone to a remote command-execution vulnerability.
An attacker can exploit this issue to execute arbitrary operating system commands with SYSTEM privileges, leading to a complete compromise of an affected computer.

NOTE: Calls to DBMS_JAVA.RUNJAVA And DBMS_JAVA_TEST.FUNCALL functions should be considered suspicious and any event should be investigated.

name: Restrict Access To Oracle DBMS_JAVA.SET_OUTPUT_TO_JAVA And DBMS_JAVA.SET_OUTPUT_TO_SQL Functions
description:
Oracle Database is prone to a remote command-execution vulnerability.
An attacker can exploit this issue to execute arbitrary operating system commands with SYSTEM privileges, leading to a complete compromise of an affected computer.

NOTE: Calls to DBMS_JAVA.SET_OUTPUT_TO_JAVA And DBMS_JAVA.SET_OUTPUT_TO_SQL functions should be considered suspicious and any event should be investigated.

name: Adobe ColdFusion Solr Collections Information Disclosure
description: The default configuration of Adobe ColdFusion does not restrict access to collections that have been created by the Solr Service, which allows remote attackers to obtain collection metadata, search information, and index data via a request to an unspecified URL.

name: Microsoft PowerPoint Data Out Of Bounds Vulnerability
description: A remote code execution vulnerability exists in the way that Microsoft Office PowerPoint handles specially crafted PowerPoint files. An attacker could exploit the vulnerability by creating a specially crafted PowerPoint file that could be hosted on a specially crafted or compromised Web site.

name: Restrict Access To "oracle/aurora/util/Wrapper" Class
description:
Oracle Database is prone to a remote command-execution vulnerability.
An attacker can exploit this issue to execute arbitrary operating system commands with SYSTEM privileges, leading to a complete compromise of an affected computer.

NOTE: Calls to "oracle/aurora/util/Wrapper" class should be considered suspicious and any event should be investigated.

name: Restrict Access To Oracle DBMS_JVM_EXP_PERMS.IMPORT_JVM_PERMS Procedure
description:
Oracle Database is prone to a remote command-execution vulnerability.
An attacker can exploit this issue to execute arbitrary operating system commands with SYSTEM privileges, leading to a complete compromise of an affected computer.

NOTE: Calls to Oracle DBMS_JVM_EXP_PERMS.IMPORT_JVM_PERMS  procedure should be considered suspicious and any event should be investigated.

name: PowerPoint Viewer TextBytesAtom Record Stack Overflow Vulnerability
description: A remote code execution vulnerability exists in the way that Microsoft Office PowerPoint viewer handles specially crafted PowerPoint files. An attacker who successfully exploited this vulnerability could take complete control of an affected system.

name: PowerPoint OEPlaceholderAtom 'placementId' Invalid Array Indexing Vulnerability
description: A remote code execution vulnerability exists in the way that Microsoft Office PowerPoint handles specially crafted PowerPoint files. An attacker who successfully exploited this vulnerability could take complete control of an affected system.

name: Office PowerPoint Viewer TextCharsAtom Record Stack Overflow Vulnerability
description: A remote code execution vulnerability exists in the way that Microsoft Office PowerPoint Viewer handles specially crafted PowerPoint files. An attacker who successfully exploited this vulnerability could take complete control of an affected system.

name: Sun Java Systems Web Server Multiple Vulnerabilities
description: Sun Java System Web Server is prone to multiple vulnerabilities because it fails to properly sanitize user-supplied input. Few issues affect the WebDAV functionality. Attackers can exploit these issues to execute arbitrary code within the context of the affected application.

name: Expat UTF-8 Character XML Parsing Remote Denial Of Service
description: The updatePosition function in lib/xmltok_impl.c in libexpat in Expat, as used in Python, PyXML, w3c-libwww, and other software, allows context-dependent attackers to cause a denial of service (application crash) via an XML document with crafted UTF-8 sequences that trigger a buffer over-read.

name: Rising Online Virus Scanner ActiveX Control 'Scan()' Method Stack Buffer Overflow Vulnerability
description: Rising Online Virus Scanner ActiveX control is prone to a buffer-overflow vulnerability because it fails to perform adequate boundary checks on user-supplied data. Successful exploits may allow an attacker to execute arbitrary code in the context of a user running the affected application. Failed attempts will likely result in denial-of-service conditions.

name: Mozilla Firefox Multiple Remote Memory Corruption Vulnerabilities
description: Mozilla Firefox is prone to multiple remote memory-corruption vulnerabilities. Successful exploits may allow an attacker to execute arbitrary code in the context of the user running the affected application. Failed exploit attempts will result in a denial-of-service condition.

name: Internet Explorer Remote Code Execution
description: Internet Explorer is prone to a vulnerability that lets attackers to add users remotely. The issue occurs because the control fails to sanitize user-supplied input. Successful exploits may compromise affected computers and could aid in further attacks.

name: VMware Products Directory Traversal Vulnerability
description: Directory traversal vulnerability in VMware Server, VMware ESXi, and VMware ESX allows remote attackers to read arbitrary files via unspecified vectors.

name: Adobe Reader And Acrobat 'newplayer()' JavaScript Method Code Execution Vulnerability
description: Adobe Reader and Acrobat are prone to a remote code-execution vulnerability. An attacker can exploit this issue to execute arbitrary code. Failed exploit attempts will likely cause denial-of-service conditions.

name: MIT Kerberos KDC 'handle_tgt_authdata()' Denial Of Service
description: The Key Distribution Center (KDC) in MIT Kerberos 5 (aka krb5) allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (assertion failure and daemon crash) via an invalid (1) AS-REQ or (2) TGS-REQ request.

name: ProFTP 'Welcome Message' Remote Buffer Overflow Vulnerability
description: ProFTP is prone to a remote buffer-overflow vulnerability. An attacker can exploit this issue to execute arbitrary code within the context of the affected application. Failed exploit attempts will result in a denial-of-service condition.

name: IBM Cognos Server Backdoor Account Remote Code Execution
description: IBM Cognos Express allows attackers to obtain unspecified access to the Tomcat Manager component, and cause a denial of service, by leveraging hardcoded credentials.

name: Xpdf Null Pointer Dereference Denial Of Service Vulnerability
description: Integer overflow in the ImageStream::ImageStream function in Stream.cc in Xpdf, as used in GPdf, kdegraphics KPDF, and CUPS pdftops, allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (application crash) via a crafted PDF document that triggers a NULL pointer dereference or buffer over-read.

name: Windows Media Player .mpg File Buffer Overflow
description: A remote code execution vulnerability exists in Windows Media Player which could allow remote attackers to cause a denial of service or possibly execute arbitrary code on the system.

name: Microsoft Internet Explorer Multitudinous Looping Denial Of Service
description: A denial of service vulnerability exists in Microsoft Internet Explorer because it does not properly handle a certain ActiveX control.

name: IBM WebSphere Application Server Cross Site Scripting Vulnerability
description: IBM WebSphere Application Server (WAS) is prone to a cross-site scripting vulnerability because it fails to properly sanitize user-supplied input. An attacker may leverage this issue to execute arbitrary script code in the browser of an unsuspecting user in the context of the affected site. This may let the attacker steal cookie-based authentication credentials and launch other attacks.

name: Trend Micro URL Filtering Engine Buffer Overflow Vulnerability
description: Trend Micro OfficeScan is prone to a buffer-overflow vulnerability because the application fails to properly bounds-check user-supplied data before copying it into an insufficiently sized memory buffer. Successful exploits may allow an attacker to execute arbitrary code within the context of the affected application. This may facilitate a complete compromise of vulnerable computers. Failed exploit attempts will likely result in denial of service conditions.

name: Apple Safari CSS Style Stack Overflow Denial Of Service
description: A stack overflow vulnerability exists in Apple Safari due to long malformed string inside style tag. Successful attack can cause browser to crash throwing a stack overflow.

name: Microsoft Internet Explorer win32hlp Remote Code Execution
description: Microsoft Internet Explorer does not properly validate parameters passed to the MsgBox function. This vulnerability could allow an attacker to host a maliciously crafted web page and run arbitrary code if they could convince a user to visit the web page and then get them to press the F1 key in response to a pop up dialog box.

name: PostgreSQL bitsubstr Overflow
description: PostgreSQL is prone to a buffer-overflow vulnerability because the application fails to perform adequate boundary checks on user-supplied data. Attackers can exploit this issue to execute arbitrary code with elevated privileges or crash the affected application.

name: Internet Explorer DHTML Object Memory Corruption Vulnerability
description: Race condition in the memory management routines in the DHTML object processor in Microsoft Internet Explorer allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code via a malicious web page or HTML e-mail, aka "DHTML Object Memory Corruption Vulnerability".

name: Mozilla Firefox And Opera Long String Denial Of Service
description: Mozilla Firefox and Opera is prone to a remote denial-of-service vulnerability. Attackers can exploit this vulnerability to crash the affected browser, resulting in denial-of-service conditions.

name: Mozilla Firefox URL Spoofing Vulnerability
description: Mozilla Firefox could allow a remote attacker to conduct spoofing attacks using a specially-crafted document.location and JavaScript through a malicious webpage that appears to be trusted.

name: IBM DB2 9.7 Heap Overflow
description: IBM DB2 is prone to a heap-based buffer-overflow vulnerability because the application fails to perform adequate boundary checks on user-supplied data. Attackers can exploit this issue to execute arbitrary code with elevated privileges or crash the affected application.

name: Mozilla Firefox Floating Point Number Conversion Memory Corruption
description: Array index error in Mozilla Firefox allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code via a long string that triggers incorrect memory allocation and a heap-based buffer overflow during conversion to a floating-point number.

name: IBM Informix Dynamic Server librpc.dll Multiple Buffer Overflows
description: Multiple buffer overflows in the authentication functionality in librpc.dll in the Informix Storage Manager (ISM) Portmapper service (aka portmap.exe), as used in IBM Informix Dynamic Server (IDS) and EMC Legato NetWorker, allow remote attackers to execute arbitrary code via a crafted parameter size.

name: VLC Media Player Bookmark Creation Buffer Overflow Vulnerability
description: VLC Media Player is prone to a buffer-overflow vulnerability because it fails to perform adequate boundary checks on user-supplied data. Attackers may leverage this issue to execute arbitrary code in the context of the application. Failed attacks will cause denial-of-service conditions.

name: Tivoli Directory Server 6.2 do_extendedOp DoS
description: A vulnerability was reported in IBM Tivoli Directory Server. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions by sending a specially crafted request to the target ibmslapd server.

name: Symantec Products CLIproxy.dll ActiveX Control Buffer Overflow
description: Symantec's Client Proxy ActiveX control (CLIproxy.dll) is prone to a buffer overflow attack because the application fails to perform boundary checks on user supplied input.  This buffer overflow can allow an attacker to inject and execute arbitrary code in the context of the application using the ActiveX control.  Failed code execution is likely to cause an abnormal termination of the browser application.

name: Microsoft Office Excel FNGROUPNAME Record Uninitialized Memory Vulnerability
description: A remote code execution vulnerability exists in the way that Microsoft Office Excel handles specially crafted Excel files. An attacker who successfully exploited this vulnerability could take complete control of an affected system.

name: Microsoft Office Excel DbOrParamQry Record Parsing Vulnerability
description: A remote code execution vulnerability exists in the way that Microsoft Office Excel handles specially crafted Excel files. An attacker who successfully exploited this vulnerability could take complete control of an affected system.

name: Microsoft Office Excel Record Memory Corruption Vulnerability
description: A remote code execution vulnerability exists in the way that Microsoft Office Excel handles specially crafted Excel files. An attacker who successfully exploited this vulnerability could take complete control of an affected system.

name: Yahoo Player (.m3u/.pls/.ypl) Buffer Overflow
description: A remote code execution vulnerability exists in Yahoo Player which could allow remote attackers to cause a denial of service or possibly execute arbitrary code on the system.

name: Microsoft Office Excel MDXTUPLE Record Heap Overflow Vulnerability
description: A remote code execution vulnerability exists in the way that Microsoft Office Excel handles specially crafted Excel files. An attacker who successfully exploited this vulnerability could take complete control of an affected system.

name: McAfee LinuxShield 'nailsd' Daemon Remote Code Execution Vulnerability
description:
McAfee LinuxShield is prone to a remote code-execution vulnerability.
Exploiting this issue allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code with superuser privileges. Successfully exploiting this issue will completely compromise affected computers.

name: Microsoft Windows Media Player AVI File Colorspace Conversion Remote Memory Corruption Vulnerability
description: Microsoft Windows Media Player is prone to a remote memory-corruption vulnerability when handling specially crafted AVI files. An attacker can exploit this issue by enticing an unsuspecting user to open a malicious file with the vulnerable application. A successful exploit may allow arbitrary code to run in the context of the currently logged-in user.

name: Sun Java Runtime Environment ActiveX Control Multiple Remote Buffer Overflow Vulnerabilities
description: Sun Java Runtime Environment is prone to multiple remote buffer-overflow vulnerabilities because the application fails to perform adequate boundary checks on user-supplied data. Successfully exploiting these issues allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code in the context of the application using the ActiveX control (typically Internet Explorer). Failed exploit attempts will likely result in denial-of-service conditions.

name: DHCP Stack Overflow In 'dhclient' script_write_params
description: Stack-based buffer overflow in the script_write_params method in client/dhclient.c in ISC DHCP dhclient allows remote DHCP servers to execute arbitrary code via a crafted subnet-mask option.

name: Microsoft Communicator SIP INVITE Request Handling Denial Of Service
description: Microsoft Communicator allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (memory consumption) via a large number of SIP INVITE requests, which trigger the creation of many sessions.

name: Adobe SWF Vulnerability
description: Adobe Flash Player is prone to a remote denial of service vulnerability. Successful exploitation will allow attackers to crash the browser, denying service to legitimate users.

name: Media Player With K-Lite Codec Pack Denial Of Service
description: Media Player with K-Lite Codec Pack is prone to denial of service vulnerability while processing a malformed AVI file.

name: Microsoft Office Excel MDXSET Record Heap Overflow Vulnerability
description: A remote code execution vulnerability exists in the way that Microsoft Office Excel handles specially crafted Excel files. An attacker who successfully exploited this vulnerability could take complete control of an affected system.

name: Opera Web Browser 'Content-Length' Buffer Overflow Vulnerability
description: Opera Web Browser is prone to a buffer-overflow vulnerability. Exploiting this issue may allow remote attackers to execute arbitrary code in the context of the application. Failed attacks will likely cause denial-of-service conditions.

name: IBM Lotus Notes 'names.nsf' Open Redirection Vulnerability
description: IBM Lotus Notes is prone to an open-redirection vulnerability because the application fails to properly sanitize user-supplied input. A successful exploit may aid in phishing attacks; other attacks are possible.

name: SpamAssassin Milter Plugin 'mlfi_envrcpt()' Remote Arbitrary Command Injection Vulnerability
description: SpamAssassin Milter Plugin is prone to a remote command-injection vulnerability because it fails to adequately sanitize user-supplied input data. Remote attackers can exploit this issue to execute arbitrary shell commands with root privileges.

name: Apple Safari Nested 'object' Tag Remote Denial Of Service
description: Apple Safari is prone to a remote denial-of-service vulnerability. Successful exploits may allow an attacker to crash the affected browser, resulting in a denial-of-service condition. Given the nature of this issue, memory corruption or code execution might be possible, but has not been confirmed.

name: Mozilla Firefox WOFF Font Processing Integer Overflow
description: Mozilla Firefox is prone to a remote code-execution vulnerability. Successful exploits may allow an attacker to execute arbitrary code in the context of the user running the affected application or to obtain sensitive information.

name: SAP GUI SAPBExCommonResources ActiveX Command Execution
description: A buffer overflow vulnerability has been reported in SAP GUI SAPBExCommonResources ActiveX control. This may allow remote attackers to execute arbitrary command by enticing the target user to open a maliciously crafted HTML document.

name: OpenOffice.org XPM File Processing Integer Overflow
description: Integer overflow in the XPMReader::ReadXPM function in filter.vcl/ixpm/svt_xpmread.cxx in OpenOffice.org (OOo) allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code via a crafted XPM file that triggers a heap-based buffer overflow.

name: IBM WebSphere Portal Portlet Palette Search HTML Injection Vulnerability
description: IBM WebSphere Portal is prone to an HTML-injection vulnerability because it fails to properly sanitize user-supplied input. An authenticated attacker may leverage this issue to execute arbitrary script code in the browser of an unsuspecting user in the context of the affected site. This may help the attacker steal cookie-based authentication credentials and launch other attacks.

name: Mozilla Firefox 'gfxTextRun::SanitizeGlyphRuns()' Remote Memory Corruption Vulnerability
description: Mozilla Firefox is prone to a remote memory-corruption vulnerability. Successful exploits may allow an attacker to execute arbitrary code in the context of the user running the affected application. Failed exploit attempts will result in a denial-of-service condition.

name: Mozilla Firefox 'window.location' Same Origin Policy Security Bypass Vulnerability
description: Mozilla Firefox is prone to a security-bypass vulnerability. Attackers can exploit this issue to bypass the same-origin policy and certain access restrictions to access data or execute arbitrary script code in the browser of an unsuspecting user in the context of another site. This could be used to steal sensitive information or to launch other attacks.

name: cURL/libcURL HTTP 'Location:' Redirect Security Bypass Vulnerability
description: The redirect implementation in curl and libcurl 5.11 through 7.19.3, when CURLOPT_FOLLOWLOCATION is enabled, accepts arbitrary Location values, which might allow remote HTTP servers to (1) trigger arbitrary requests to intranet servers, (2) read or overwrite arbitrary files via a redirect to a file: URL, or (3) execute arbitrary commands via a redirect to an scp: URL.

name: SAP MaxDB Malformed Handshake Request Remote Code Execution
description: There is a vulnerability in the serv.exe process of SAP MaxDB.This vulnerability allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code on vulnerable installations of SAP MaxDB.

name: Uninitialized Memory Corruption Remote Vulnerability
description: A remote code execution vulnerability exists in the way that Internet Explorer accesses an object that has not been correctly initialized or has been deleted. An attacker could exploit the vulnerability by constructing a specially crafted Web page. When a user views the Web page, the vulnerability could allow remote code execution. An attacker who successfully exploited this vulnerability could gain the same user rights as the logged-on user.

name: Microsoft Word Remote Code Execution
description: This malicious word document is used in a spam attack. Remote code execution is possible using this exploit.

name: HTML Object Memory Corruption Remote Execution Vulnerability
description: A remote code execution vulnerability exists in the way that Internet Explorer accesses an object that has not been correctly initialized or has been deleted. An attacker could exploit the vulnerability by constructing a specially crafted Web page. When a user views the Web page, the vulnerability could allow remote code execution. An attacker who successfully exploited this vulnerability could gain the same user rights as the logged-on user.

name: HTML Element Cross-Domain Vulnerability
description: An information disclosure vulnerability exists in Internet Explorer that could allow script to gain access to a browser window in another domain or Internet Explorer zone. An attacker could exploit the vulnerability by constructing a specially crafted Web page that could allow information disclosure if a user viewed the Web page and then drags the browser window across a second browser window.

name: Memory Corruption Vulnerability
description: A remote code execution vulnerability exists in the way that Internet Explorer manages a long URL in certain situations. An attacker could exploit the vulnerability by constructing a specially crafted Web page. When a user views the Web page, the vulnerability could allow remote code execution. An attacker who successfully exploited this vulnerability could gain the same user rights as the logged on user.

name: Race Condition Memory Corruption Vulnerability
description: A remote code execution vulnerability exists in the way that Internet Explorer accesses an object that may have been corrupted due to a race condition. An attacker could exploit the vulnerability by constructing a specially crafted Web page. When a user views the Web page, the vulnerability could allow remote code execution. An attacker who successfully exploited this vulnerability could gain the same user rights as the logged-on user.

name: Post Encoding Information Disclosure Vulnerability
description: An information disclosure vulnerability exists in the way that Internet Explorer handles content using specific encoding strings when submitting data. An attacker could exploit the vulnerability by constructing a specially crafted Web page that could allow information disclosure if a user viewed the Web page. An attacker who successfully exploited this vulnerability could view content from the local computer or another browser window in another domain or Internet Explorer zone.

name: HTML Rendering  Memory Corruption
description: A remote code execution vulnerability exists in the way that Internet Explorer accesses an object that has been deleted. An attacker could exploit the vulnerability by constructing a specially crafted Web page. When a user views the Web page, the vulnerability could allow remote code execution. An attacker who successfully exploited this vulnerability could gain the same user rights as the logged-on user.

name: Adobe Acrobat And Reader Remote Code Execution Vulnerability
description: Adobe Acrobat and Reader are prone to remote code-execution vulnerability. An attacker can exploit this issue to execute arbitrary code with the privileges of the user running the application or crash the application, denying service to legitimate users.

name: Adobe Acrobat And Reader Remote Denial Of Service
description: Adobe Acrobat and Reader are prone to remote code-execution vulnerability. An attacker can exploit this issue to execute arbitrary code with the privileges of the user running the application or crash the application, denying service to legitimate users.

name: Adobe Acrobat And Reader Remote Code Execution
description: Adobe Acrobat Reader allows remote attackers to cause a buffer overflow and possibly execute arbitrary code via a malformed PDF document.

name: HTML Object Memory Corruption Remote Vulnerability
description: A remote code execution vulnerability exists in the way that Internet Explorer accesses an object that has not been correctly initialized or has been deleted. An attacker could exploit the vulnerability by constructing a specially crafted Web page. When a user views the Web page, the vulnerability could allow remote code execution. An attacker who successfully exploited this vulnerability could gain the same user rights as the logged-on user.

name: Apple Safari HTML Image Element Handling Use After Free Vulnerability
description: Use-after-free vulnerability in WebKit in Apple Safari allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code or cause a denial of service (application crash) via vectors involving HTML IMG elements.

name: Uninitialized Memory Corruption Remote Code Vulnerability
description: A remote code execution vulnerability exists in the way that Internet Explorer accesses an object that has not been correctly initialized or has been deleted. An attacker could exploit the vulnerability by constructing a specially crafted Web page. When a user views the Web page, the vulnerability could allow remote code execution. An attacker who successfully exploited this vulnerability could gain the same user rights as the logged-on user.

name: Adobe Acrobat And Reader Denial Of Service
description: Adobe Acrobat Reader allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service and possibly execute arbitrary code via a malformed PDF document.

name: Adobe TIFF File Buffer Overflow Vulnerability - 2
description: Adobe Acrobat Reader allows remote attackers to cause a buffer overflow and possibly execute arbitrary code via a malformed PDF document.

name: Mozilla Multiple Products JavaScript String Replace Buffer Overflow
description: Multiple unspecified vulnerabilities in the JavaScript engine in Mozilla Firefox before 3.0.14, and 3.5.x before 3.5.2, allow remote attackers to cause a denial of service (memory corruption and application crash) or possibly execute arbitrary code via unknown vectors.

name: Apple Safari Right-to-Left Text Rendering Use After Free Vulnerability
description: Safari contains a vulnerability involving the use of the HTML direction tags to specify when text should be displayed right to left.  The vulnerability involves improper freeing of memory and causes a use-after-free condition potentially allowing an attacker to run arbitrary code in the security context of the user.  If an attack is unsuccessful, it may cause Safari to terminate abnormally.

name: Mozilla Firefox URL Denial Of Service
description: The URL handler in Mozilla Firefox allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (crash) and possibly execute arbitrary code via certain vectors that trigger memory corruption and assertion failures.

name: Oracle Java Soundbank Resource Name Stack Buffer Overflow
description: Unspecified vulnerability in the Sound component in Oracle Java SE and Java for Business allows remote attackers to affect confidentiality, integrity, and availability via unknown vectors.

name: Squid Proxy HTCP Packet Processing Denial Of Service
description: The htcpHandleTstRequest function in htcp.c in allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (crash) via crafted packets to the HTCP port, which triggers a NULL pointer dereference.

name: Adobe Reader 'getAnnots()' And 'customDictionaryOpen()' Javascript Function Remote Code Execution
description: Adobe Reader is prone to a remote code-execution vulnerability. An attacker can exploit this issue to execute arbitrary code with the privileges of the user running the application or crash the application, denying service to legitimate users.

name: Liquid XML Studio LtXmlComHelp8.dll ActiveX OpenFile Buffer Overflow
description: Liquid XML Studio 8.061970 and prior are vulnerable to a buffer overflow attack when accessing the LtXmlComHelp8.dll through the OpenFile() function.  This buffer overflow can allow an attacker to inject and execute arbitrary code run with the privileges of the logged in user.

name: Multiple Vendors librpc.dll Stack Buffer Overflow
description: The 'librpc.dll' RPC protocol parsing library is prone to a remote stack-based buffer-overflow vulnerability because it fails to perform adequate boundary-checks on user-supplied data. Successfully exploiting this issue will allow attackers to execute arbitrary code with SYSTEM-level privileges. Failed exploit attempts will result in a denial-of-service condition.

name: WinVerifyTrust Signature Validation Vulnerability
description: A remote code execution vulnerability exists in the Windows Authenticode Signature Verification function used for portable executable (PE) and cabinet file formats. An anonymous attacker could exploit the vulnerability by modifying an existing signed executable file to manipulate unverified portions of the signature and file in such a way as to add malicious code to the file without invalidating the signature. An attacker who successfully exploited this vulnerability could take complete control of an affected system.

name: MagnetoSoft DNS ActiveX DNSLookupHostWithServer Vulnerability
description: MagnetoSoft DNS ActiveX DNSLookupHostWithServer control is prone to a ICMP crash vulnerability because the application fails to perform adequate boundary checks on user-supplied data. Successful exploits allow remote attackers to execute arbitrary code in the context of the application using the ActiveX control.

name: MagnetoSoft NetworkResources ActiveX Vulnerabilities
description: MagnetoSoft NetworkResources ActiveX control is prone to a vulnerability that lets attackers overwrite files with arbitrary, attacker-controlled content. Successfully exploiting this issue will allow an attacker to overwrite arbitrary files and execute arbitrary code on the victim's computer in the context of the vulnerable application using the ActiveX control.

name: VMware Player And Workstation 'vmware-authd' Remote Denial Of Service
description: VMware Authentication Daemon in vmware-authd.exe in the VMware Authorization Service in VMware Workstation, VMware Player, and VMware ACE  allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (process crash) via a \x25\xFF sequence in the USER and PASS commands, related to a "format string DoS" issue.

name: HP Operations Manager LoadFile()/SaveFile() Remote Unicode Stack Overflow
description: A remote stack overflow vulnerability has been reported in HP Operations Manager. A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system because the application fails to adequately check the input supplied to 'srcvw4.dll' or 'srcvw32.dll'.

name: MagnetoSoft SNTP ActiveX SntpSendRequest Denial Of Service
description: MagnetoSoft SNTP ActiveX SntpSendRequest control is prone to a buffer overflow attack because the application fails to perform boundary checks on user-supplied data. Successful exploits allow remote attackers to execute arbitrary code in the context of the application using the ActiveX control.

name: EDraw Flowchart ActiveX Control '.edd' File Buffer Overflow
description: The EDraw Flowchart ActiveX control is prone to a buffer-overflow vulnerability because it fails to perform adequate boundary-checks on user-supplied data. An attacker can exploit this issue to execute arbitrary code within the context of the affected application, typically Internet Explorer, that uses the ActiveX control. Failed exploit attempts will result in a denial-of-service condition.

name: EDraw Flowchart ActiveX Control 'OpenDocument()' Method Remote Code Execution Vulnerability
description: EDraw Flowchart ActiveX control is prone to a remote code-execution vulnerability caused by a memory-corruption error. An attacker can exploit this issue to execute arbitrary code in the context of the application, usually Internet Explorer, using the ActiveX control. Failed attacks will likely cause denial-of-service conditions.

name: Apple Safari CSS Format Argument Handling Memory Corruption
description: The Cascading Style Sheets (CSS) implementation in WebKit in Apple Safari allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code or cause a denial of service (memory corruption and application crash) via crafted format arguments.

name: Foxit Reader 'Date()' Denial Of Service Vulnerability
description: Foxit Reader is prone to a denial-of-service vulnerability because of an input validation error. Successfully exploiting this issue may allow attackers to crash the affected application, denying service to legitimate users.

name: Multiple Vendors AgentX receive_agentx Integer Overflow
description: Integer overflow in the AgentX::receive_agentx function in AgentX++, as used in RealNetworks Helix Server and Helix Mobile Server and other products, allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code via a request with a crafted payload length.

name: MagnetoSoft SNTP ActiveX SntpGetReply Vulnerability
description: MagnetoSoft SNTP ActiveX contol is prone to a crash vulnerability because the application fails to perform adequate boundary checks on user-supplied data. Successful exploitation allows arbitrary code to executed in the context of the application using the ActiveX control.

name: HP Digital Imaging hpodio08.dll Insecure Method Vulnerability
description: HP's Digital Imaging can allow arbitrary files to be written to to a user's computer.  The file transfer can be triggered by a specially crafted web page.

name: Apple Safari CSS 'img' Data Remote Denial Of Service
description: Apple Safari is prone to a remote denial-of-service vulnerability. Successful exploits allow an attacker to crash the affected browser, resulting in a denial-of-service condition. Given the nature of this issue, memory corruption or code execution may be possible, but has not been confirmed.

name: BigAnt Office Messenger 'AntCore.dll' ActiveX Control Multiple Heap Buffer Overflow
description: BigAnt Office Messenger is prone to multiple heap-based buffer-overflow vulnerabilities because the application fails to adequately check boundaries on user-supplied input. An attacker can exploit these issues to execute arbitrary code in the context of the application, typically Internet Explorer, using the ActiveX control. Failed attacks will likely cause denial-of-service conditions.

name: Multiple Browsers Long Unicode Denial Of Service
description: Multiple browsers like Internet Explorer, Firefox are prone to a remote denial of service vulnerability. Successful exploits can allow attackers to crash the affected browser, resulting in a denial of service condition.

name: Multiple Browsers Document Writing Uninitialized Memory Access
description: A vulnerability has been discovered in multiple browsers like Opera, Safari which can be exploited by malicious people to compromise a user's system. The vulnerability is caused due to an error when e.g. continuously writing content to a page using document.write() and results in a function call using uninitialised memory when a user visits a specially crafted web page. Successful exploitation may allow execution of arbitrary code.

name: Safari Denial Of Service Vulnerability
description: Apple QuickTime is prone to a denial-of-service vulnerability. An attacker will exploit this issue by enticing a user to visit a malicious site. Successful exploits may allow the attacker to crash the affected application, denying service to legitimate users.

name: RealNetworks Helix Server NTLM Authentication Heap Overflow
description: Heap-based buffer overflow in the NTLM authentication functionality in RealNetworks Helix Server and Helix Mobile Server allows remote attackers to have an unspecified impact via invalid base64-encoded data.

name: Adobe Photoshop TIFF File Remote Code Execution
description: Critical vulnerabilities have been identified in Photoshop CS4 that could allow an attacker who successfully exploits these vulnerabilities to take control of the affected system. A malicious .TIFF file must be opened in Photoshop CS4 by the user for an attacker to exploit these vulnerabilities.

name: Mozilla Firefox Fork Bomb Denial Of Service
description: Mozilla Firefox is prone to a remote denial of service vulnerability. Successful exploitation can allow attackers to bypass the popup blocker and hang the browser resulting in a denial of service condition.

name: Mozilla Firefox Multitudinous Looping Denial Of Service
description: A denial of service vulnerability exists in Mozilla Firefox because it does not properly handle the window.print() function when it is in a multitudinous loop.

name: HP System Management Homepage 'RedirectUrl' Parameter URI Redirection Vulnerability
description: HP System Management Homepage is prone to an open-redirection vulnerability because the application fails to properly sanitize user-supplied input. A successful exploit may aid in phishing attacks, other attacks are possible.

name: Apple Safari JavaScriptCore.dll Denial Of Service
description: There is a vulnerability in Apple Safari. Attackers can exploit this issue by enticing user to open malicious web pages.

name: Google Chrome Remote Memory Corruption
description: There is a vulnerability in Google Chrome web browser. Attackers can exploit this issue by enticing user to access malicious web pages.

name: Microsoft Visio 'DXF' File Insertion Buffer Overflow
description: Microsoft Visio is prone to a remote buffer-overflow vulnerability. This issue arises when the application processes a malicious file. Attackers can exploit this issue to execute arbitrary code in the context of the user running the application. Failed exploit attempts will result in a denial-of-service condition.

name: Multiple Browsers history.go() Denial Of Service
description: Multiple Browsers like Apple Safari, etc. allows remote attackers to steal navigation history and cause a denial of service via a crafted page.

name: Adobe Shockwave Remote Memory Corruption Vulnerability
description: There is a vulnerability in Adobe Shockwave. Attackers can exploit this issue by sending crafted malicious files.

name: Apache Tomcat Authentication Header Realm Name Information Disclosure Vulnerability
description: Apache Tomcat is prone to a remote information-disclosure vulnerability. Remote attackers can exploit this issue to obtain the host name or IP address of the Tomcat server. Information harvested may lead to further attacks.

name: Multiple Browsers 0day Denial Of Service
description: A vulnerability has been discovered in multiple browsers like Opera, Safari which can be exploited by malicious people to compromise a user's system. The vulnerability is caused due to an error when continuously writing content to a page using document.write(). Successful exploitation may allow execution of arbitrary code.

name: MS Paint Integer Overflow Vulnerability
description: A remote code execution vulnerability exists in the way that Microsoft Paint decodes JPEG images. The vulnerability could allow remote code execution if a user opens a specially crafted JPEG image file in Microsoft Paint. An attacker who successfully exploited this vulnerability could take complete control of an affected system.

name: Outlook Express And Windows Mail Integer Overflow Vulnerability
description: Outlook Express and Windows Mail have a vulnerability that could allow an attacker to run arbitrary code in the security context of the user if the Outlook Express or Windows Mail client connect to a malicious POP3 server.  This vulnerability can be exploited if the data being transferred over a connection between an Outlook Express or Windows Mail client and a safe POP3 is altered midstream.

name: Adobe TIFF File Vulnerability
description: Adobe Acrobat Reader allows remote attackers to cause a buffer overflow and possibly execute arbitrary code via a malformed PDF document.

name: VBE6.DLL Stack Memory Corruption Vulnerability
description: A remote code execution vulnerability exists in the way that Microsoft Visual Basic for Applications searches for ActiveX controls. This vulnerability could allow remote code execution if a host application opens and passes a specially crafted file to the Visual Basic for Applications run time. If a user is logged on with administrative user rights, an attacker who successfully exploited this vulnerability could take complete control of an affected system.

name: Adobe Shockwave Denial Of Service - 2
description: There is a vulnerability in Adobe Shockwave. Attackers can exploit this issue by sending crafted malicious files.

name: Restrict PDF Documents With Embedded Executable Files
description: This filter blocks PDF files containing embedded executable files.

name: Adobe Shockwave Denial Of Service
description: There is a vulnerability in Adobe Shockwave. Attackers can exploit this issue by sending crafted malicious files.

name: DNS Server Vulnerability In WPAD Registration
description: A man-in-the-middle attack vulnerability exists in Windows DNS servers where dynamic update is used and ISATAP and WPAD are not already registered in DNS. This vulnerability could allow a remote authenticated attacker to spoof a web proxy thereby redirect Internet traffic to an address of the attacker's choice.

name: Mozilla Firefox And Apple Safari Denial Of Service
description: Mozilla Firefox and Apple Safari is prone to a remote denial-of-service vulnerability. Attackers can exploit this vulnerability to crash the affected browser, resulting in denial-of-service conditions.

name: Adobe Shockwave Memory Corruption Vulnerability
description: Adobe Shockwave Player is prone to a remote memory corruption vulnerability while attempting to load a specially crafted Adobe Director File allowing remote attackers to execute arbitrary code on vulnerable installations.

name: Apple Safari 'window.parent.close()' Unspecified Remote Code Execution Vulnerability
description:
Apple Safari is prone to an unspecified remote code-execution vulnerability.
Successful exploits will allow an attacker to run arbitrary code in the context of the user running the application. Failed attacks will cause denial-of-service conditions. Note that successful exploitation of this issue requires the pop-up blocker in the browser to be  disabled. The pop-up blocker in Safari is enabled by default.

name: Alt-N MDaemon SUBSCRIBE Remote Information Disclosure Vulnerability
description: MDaemon suffers from a lack of input checking when a user attempts to subscribe to a mailing list.  This lack of input checking allows a malicious user to perform directory traversals and specify a new grp file whose properties can be used when attempting the subscribe to the mailing list.  This user specified file can only be a .grp file.

name: IncrediMail ImShExtU.dll ActiveX Memory Corruption
description: IncrediMail is prone to a memory corruption vulnerability because it fails to sufficiently check boundaries of user-supplied input before copying it to an insufficiently sized memory buffer. Successful exploits will corrupt process memory, allowing attacker-supplied arbitrary code to run in the context of the client application using the affected ActiveX control.

name: Cisco Secure Desktop CSDWebInstaller ActiveX Control Remote Code Execution
description:
The Web Install ActiveX control (CSDWebInstaller) in Cisco Secure Desktop (CSD) does not properly verify the signatures of downloaded programs, which allows remote attackers to force the download and execution of arbitrary files via a crafted web page.

Note: This vulnerability was shared with Trend Micro in advance of public disclosure by TippingPoint through its Zero Day Initiative (http://www.zerodayinitiative.com).

name: iSCSI target Multiple Implementations Format String Code Execution
description: Multiple format string vulnerabilities in isns.c in (1) Linux SCSI target framework (aka tgt or scsi-target-utils) and (2) iSCSI Enterprise Target (aka iscsitarget) 0.4.16 allow remote attackers to cause a denial of service (tgtd daemon crash) or possibly have unspecified other impact via vectors that involve the isns_attr_query and qry_rsp_handle functions, and are related to (a) client appearance and (b) client disappearance messages.

name: Apple Webkit Blink Event Dangling Pointer Remote Code Execution
description:
Use-after-free vulnerability in WebKit in Apple Safari allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code or cause a denial of service (application crash) via an HTML document with improperly nested tags.

Note: This vulnerability was shared with Trend Micro in advance of public disclosure by TippingPoint through its Zero Day Initiative (http://www.zerodayinitiative.com).

name: Apple QuickTime FlashPix Movie File Integer Overflow
description: Integer overflow in QuickTime in Apple Mac OS X before 10.6.3 allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code or cause a denial of service (application crash) via a crafted movie file with FlashPix encoding.

name: Apple WebKit CSS run-in Attribute Rendering Remote Code Execution
description:
Use-after-free vulnerability in WebKit in Apple Safari allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code or cause a denial of service (application crash) via vectors related to the run-in Cascading Style Sheets (CSS) display property.

Note: This vulnerability was shared with Trend Micro in advance of public disclosure by TippingPoint through its Zero Day Initiative (http://www.zerodayinitiative.com).

name: Mozilla Firefox nsTreeSelection EventListener Remote Code Execution
description:
Use-after-free vulnerability in the nsTreeSelection implementation in Mozilla Firefox allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code or cause a denial of service (application crash) via unspecified vectors that trigger a call to the handler for the select event for XUL tree items.

Note: This vulnerability was shared with Trend Micro in advance of public disclosure by TippingPoint through its Zero Day Initiative (http://www.zerodayinitiative.com).

name: Microsoft Windows SMTP Service DNS Response Spoofing
description: The Microsoft Windows Simple Mail Transfer Protocol (SMTP) Server is prone to a DNS spoofing vulnerability. Successfully exploiting this issue allows remote attackers to spoof DNS replies, allowing them to redirect network traffic and to launch man-in-the-middle attacks.

name: OpenSSL 'ssl3_get_record()' Remote Denial Of Service Vulnerability
description: The ssl3_get_record function in ssl/s3_pkt.c in OpenSSL allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (crash) via a malformed record in a TLS connection that triggers a NULL pointer dereference, related to the minor version number.

name: Skype URI Processing Arbitrary XML File Deletion Vulnerability
description:
This vulnerability allows remote attackers to remove arbitrary XML files on vulnerable installations of Skype. The specific flaw exists in Skype's handling of the 'skype-plugin:' protocol. An attacker can specify a malicious URI utilizing the undocumented 'save_pxml' command that upon clicking will trigger the deletion of an arbitrary attacker specified XML file.

Note: This vulnerability was shared with Trend Micro in advance of public disclosure by TippingPoint through its Zero Day Initiative (http://www.zerodayinitiative.com).

name: Skype URI Handling Security Vulnerability
description: Skype is prone to a security vulnerability because it fails to sufficiently sanitize user-supplied data. An attacker can exploit this issue to control certain Skype settings and steal sensitive information; other attacks may also be possible.

name: Apache Axis2 'xsd' Parameter Directory Traversal Vulnerability
description: Apache Axis2 is prone to a directory-traversal vulnerability because it fails to sufficiently sanitize user-supplied input. Exploiting this issue may allow an attacker to obtain sensitive information that could aid in further attacks.

name: Firefox Memory Exhaustion Denial Of Service
description: There is a vulnerability in Firefox. Attackers can exploit this issue by enticing user to open malicious web page.

name: Apple QuickTime MediaVideo Compressor Name Remote Code Execution
description:
Apple QuickTime on Windows allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code or cause a denial of service (memory corruption and application crash) via crafted color tables in a movie file, related to malformed MediaVideo data, a sample description atom (STSD), and a crafted length value.

Note: This vulnerability was shared with Trend Micro in advance of public disclosure by TippingPoint through its Zero Day Initiative (http://www.zerodayinitiative.com).

name: Mozilla Firefox Web Workers Array Data Type Remote Memory Corruption
description:
The Web Worker functionality in Mozilla Firefox does not properly handle array data types for posted messages, which allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (heap memory corruption and application crash) or possibly execute arbitrary code via unspecified vectors.

Note: This vulnerability was shared with Trend Micro in advance of public disclosure by TippingPoint through its Zero Day Initiative (http://www.zerodayinitiative.com).

name: ComponentOne VSFlexGrid "Archive()" Method Remote Buffer Overflow
description: ComponentOne FlexGrid ActiveX Control is prone to buffer-overflow vulnerability because the application fails to adequately check boundaries on user-supplied input. An attacker can exploit these issues to cause denial denial-of-service conditions and possibly to execute arbitrary code, but this has not been confirmed.

name: Mozilla Firefox Error Handling Information Disclosure Vulnerability
description: Mozilla Firefox is prone to a remote information-disclosure vulnerability. Attackers can exploit this issue to obtain potentially sensitive information that may aid in further attacks.

name: Identified Suspicious Adobe Flash SWF File
description: Adobe Flash Player allows remote attackers to cause a buffer overflow and possibly execute arbitrary code via a malformed SWF File.

name: Adobe Photoshop Remote Code Execution Vulnerability
description: Critical vulnerabilities have been identified in Photoshop CS4 for Windows that could allow an attacker who successfully exploits these vulnerabilities to take control of the affected system.

name: Google Chrome Google URL Cross Domain Security Bypass Vulnerability
description:
Google Chrome is prone to a cross-domain security-bypass vulnerability.
An attacker can exploit this vulnerability to bypass the same-origin policy. Other attacks are also possible.

name: HP Intelligent Management Center Reporting Information Disclosure
description: An information disclosure vulnerability exists in HP Intelligent Management Center. The vulnerability is due to insufficient input validation when processing HTTP request parameters.

name: Microsoft Internet Explorer CSS 'expression' Remote Denial Of Service Vulnerability
description: Microsoft Internet Explorer is prone to a remote denial-of-service vulnerability. Attackers can exploit this issue by enticing an unsuspecting user to view a specially crafted webpage. Successfully exploiting this issue will cause the application to stop responding, denying service to legitimate users.

name: PostgreSQL JOIN Hashtable Size Integer Overflow Denial Of Service Vulnerability
description: Integer overflow in src/backend/executor/nodeHash.c in PostgreSQL, allows remote authenticated users to cause a denial of service (daemon crash) via a SELECT statement with many LEFT JOIN clauses, related to certain hashtable size calculations.

name: Adobe Download Manager Atlcom.get_atlcom ActiveX Control Remote Code Execution Vulnerability
description: The Adobe Download Manager is vulnerable to a buffer overflow through ActiveX against the gp.ocx file.  The buffer overflow can allow for the execution of arbitrary code run in the context of the broswer.

name: Adobe InDesign CS3 INDD File Handling Buffer Overflow
description: Adobe InDesign is prone to a remote buffer-overflow vulnerability. Attackers can exploit this issue to execute arbitrary code in the context of the user running an affected application or to cause a denial-of-service condition.

name: WebKit Right-to-Left Displayed Text Handling Memory Corruption
description: Use-after-free vulnerability in WebKit in Apple Safari allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code or cause a denial of service (application crash) via HTML elements with right-to-left (RTL) text directionality.

name: Mozilla Firefox nsTreeContentView Dangling Pointer Remote Code Execution
description:
Mozilla Firefox does not properly manage reference counts for option elements in a XUL tree optgroup, which might allow remote attackers to execute arbitrary code via unspecified vectors that trigger access to deleted elements, related to a "dangling pointer vulnerability."

Note: This vulnerability was shared with Trend Micro in advance of public disclosure by TippingPoint through its Zero Day Initiative (http://www.zerodayinitiative.com).

name: Excel Record Parsing Memory Corruption Vulnerability
description: A remote code execution vulnerability exists in the way that Microsoft Office Excel handles specially crafted Excel files. An attacker who successfully exploited this vulnerability could take complete control of an affected system.

name: Microsoft IE toStaticHTML Information Disclosure Vulnerability
description: An information disclosure vulnerability exists in the way that Internet Explorer handles content using specific strings when sanitizing HTML. An attacker could exploit the vulnerability by constructing a specially crafted Web page that could allow information disclosure if a user viewed the Web page. An attacker who successfully exploited this vulnerability could inflict cross-site scripting on the user, allowing the attacker to execute script in the user's security context against a site that is using the toStaticHTML API.

name: Multiple Browser Denial Of Service
description: Mozilla Firefox executes a mail application in situations where an IFRAME element has a news: or nntp: URL in its SRC attribute, which allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (excessive application launches) via an HTML document with many IFRAME elements.

name: Excel Record Stack Corruption Vulnerability
description: A remote code execution vulnerability exists in the way that Microsoft Office Excel handles specially crafted Excel files. An attacker who successfully exploited this vulnerability could take complete control of an affected system.

name: Excel ADO Object Vulnerability
description: A remote code execution vulnerability exists in the way that Microsoft Office Excel handles specially crafted Excel files. An attacker who successfully exploited this vulnerability could take complete control of an affected system.

name: Microsoft Office Excel Memory Corruption Vulnerability
description: A remote code execution vulnerability exists in the way that Microsoft Office Excel handles specially crafted Excel files. An attacker who successfully exploited this vulnerability could take complete control of an affected system.

name: Microsoft IE Cross-Domain Information Disclosure Vulnerability
description: Internet Explorer stores information such as the URLs of past websites visited in an index.dat file.  It is possible for an attacker to inject scripts into this file which can allow access to other local files if the index.dat file is rendered in Internet Explorer.

name: XML Signature HMAC Truncation Authentication Bypass Vulnerability
description: The design of the W3C XML Signature Syntax and Processing (XMLDsig) recommendation, as implemented in several products uses a parameter that defines an HMAC truncation length (HMACOutputLength) but does not require a minimum for this length, which allows attackers to spoof HMAC-based signatures and bypass authentication by specifying a truncation length with a small number of bits.

name: MS Office Excel Memory Corruption Vulnerability
description: A remote code execution vulnerability exists in the way that Microsoft Office Excel handles specially crafted Excel files. An attacker who successfully exploited this vulnerability could take complete control of an affected system.

name: Adobe Flash Player Remote Code Execution Vulnerabilities
description: Adobe Flash Player is prone to remote code execution vulnerabilities. This could allow an attacker to possibly take complete control of an affected system.

name: Adobe Flash Player Remote Code Execution Vulnerabilities - 3
description: Adobe Flash Player is prone to remote code execution vulnerabilities. This could allow an attacker to possibly take complete control of an affected system.

name: Adobe Flash Player Remote Code Execution Vulnerabilities - 4
description: Adobe Flash Player is prone to remote code execution vulnerabilities. This could allow an attacker to possibly take complete control of an affected system.

name: Microsoft IE Uninitialized Memory Corruption Remote Code Execution Vulnerability
description: When importing CStyleSheets Internet Explorer is vulnerable to specially crafted web pages that can cause Internet Explorer to crash. This vulnerability can also be leveraged to execute arbitrary code.

name: Microsoft Excel Record Memory Corruption Vulnerability
description: A remote code execution vulnerability exists in the way that Microsoft Office Excel handles specially crafted Excel files. An attacker who successfully exploited this vulnerability could take complete control of an affected system.

name: Reflection Standard Suite ActiveX Buffer Overflow
description: The Reflection Standard Suite is vulnerable to a buffer overflow in the ActiveX control for r2axctrl.ocx.  This buffer overflow typically causes the Reflection Standard Suite to crash, but may be leveraged to execute arbitrary code.

name: Multiple Vendors OPIE Off-by-one Stack Buffer Overflow
description: OPIE is prone to an off-by-one memory-corruption vulnerability because it fails to properly bounds-check user-supplied data before copying it into a memory buffer. Attackers can exploit this issue to crash a vulnerable application using OPIE, resulting in a denial-of-service condition.

name: Adobe Flash Player Remote Code Execution Vulnerabilities - 5
description: Adobe Flash Player is prone to remote code execution vulnerabilities. This could allow an attacker to possibly take complete control of an affected system.

name: Microsoft Help and Support Center 'sysinfo/sysinfomain.htm' Cross Site Scripting Weakness
description: Help and Support Center is prone to a cross-site scripting weakness because it fails to properly sanitize user-supplied input.  An attacker may leverage this issue to execute arbitrary script code in the privileged zone of the browser of an unsuspecting user.

name: Novell ZENworks Configuration Management Preboot Service Code Execution
description: Novell ZENworks Configuration Management is prone to an unspecified remote code-execution vulnerability. An attacker can leverage this issue to execute arbitrary code with SYSTEM-level privileges. Failed exploit attempts will result in a denial-of-service condition.

name: Excel String Variable Vulnerability
description: A remote code execution vulnerability exists in the way that Microsoft Office Excel handles specially crafted Excel files. An attacker who successfully exploited this vulnerability could take complete control of an affected system.

name: VLC Media Player Malformed Media File Denial Of Service
description: A memory corruption has been reported in VideoLAN's VLC Media Player. The vulnerability is due to an uninitialized pointer dereference while handling zip files renamed as media files. A malicious user can exploit this vulnerability by enticing a user to download and process a malicious file.

name: Sygate Personal Firewall ActiveX Vulnerability
description: The SetRegString() function in the SSHelper.dll  is currently vulnerable to a buffer overflow through Active X. Passing a long character string argument will result in an exception handler being overwritten, allowing an attacker to execute arbitrary code.

name: Opera Denial Of Service
description: Opera is prone to a remote denial-of-service vulnerability. Attackers can exploit this vulnerability to crash the affected browser, resulting in denial-of-service conditions.

name: Adobe SVG Viewer Circle Transform Remote Code Execution Vulnerability
description: Adobe SVG Viewer is prone to a remote code-execution vulnerability. Attackers can exploit this issue to execute arbitrary code in the context of the application. Failed attacks may cause a denial-of-service condition.

name: ISC DHCP Server Zero Length Client ID Denial Of Service
description: ISC DHCP allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (server exit) via a zero-length client ID.

name: Excel Memory Corruption Vulnerability
description: A remote code execution vulnerability exists in the way that Microsoft Office Excel handles specially crafted Excel files. An attacker who successfully exploited this vulnerability could take complete control of an affected system.

name: OpenSSL Cryptographic Message Syntax Memory Corruption Vulnerability
description: The Cryptographic Message Syntax (CMS) implementation in crypto/cms/cms_asn1.c in OpenSSL does not properly handle structures that contain OriginatorInfo, which allows context-dependent attackers to modify invalid memory locations or conduct double-free attacks, and possibly execute arbitrary code, via unspecified vectors.

name: Mozilla Firefox Keyboard Focus Cross Domain Information Disclosure Vulnerability
description: The JavaScript implementation in Mozilla Firefox allows remote attackers to send selected keystrokes to a form field in a hidden frame, instead of the intended form field in a visible frame, via certain calls to the focus method.

name: Lighttpd mod_fastcgi Extension CGI Variable Overwriting Vulnerability
description: A variable overwriting vulnerability exists in Lighttpd FastCGI extension. A remote unauthenticated attacker can exploit this vulnerability by sending an HTTP request containing crafted header data to the target server, potentially causing information disclosure or execution of malicious scripts in the security context of web server.

name: Google Chrome Invalid FTP Server Response Remote Denial Of Service
description: Google Chrome is prone to a remote denial-of-service vulnerability because it fails to handle user-supplied input. Attackers can exploit this issue to crash the application, denying service to legitimate users.

name: Mozilla Firefox Denial Of Service Vulnerability
description: Multiple unspecified vulnerabilities in the browser engine in Mozilla Firefox allow remote attackers to cause a denial of service (memory corruption and application crash) or possibly execute arbitrary code via unknown vectors.

name: War-FTPD USER & PASS Command Overflow
description: WarFTPD is vulnerable to a buffer overflow in the way WarFTPD handles the USER and PASS commands. A remote attacker can overflow a buffer and execute arbitrary commands on the server. Versions 1.65 and earlier, in addition to 1.66x3 and earlier are also vulnerable.

name: Apple Safari Webkit Option Element ContentEditable Code Execution
description: Use-after-free vulnerability in WebKit in Apple Safari, allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code or cause a denial of service (application crash) via vectors related to removing container elements.

name: OpenSSL Cryptographic Message Syntax Memory Corruption Vulnerability - 2
description: The Cryptographic Message Syntax (CMS) implementation in crypto/cms/cms_asn1.c in OpenSSL does not properly handle structures that contain OriginatorInfo, which allows context-dependent attackers to modify invalid memory locations or conduct double-free attacks, and possibly execute arbitrary code, via unspecified vectors.

name: Novell iManager Tomcat Denial Of Service
description: Novell iManager allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (crash) in the Tomcat server via a long TREE parameter in an HTTP POST, which triggers a NULL pointer dereference.

name: Microsoft Internet Explorer 'mshtml.dll' Remote Information Disclosure Vulnerability
description: Microsoft Internet Explorer is prone to a remote information-disclosure vulnerability. Attackers can exploit this issue to gain access to sensitive information that may aid in further attacks.

name: Adobe Acrobat and Reader CoolType Typography Engine Remote Denial Of Service Vulnerability
description: Adobe Acrobat and Reader are prone to a denial-of-service vulnerability due to a memory-corruption issue. Attackers can exploit this issue to crash the affected application, denying service to legitimate users. Due to the nature of this issue, arbitrary code-execution may be possible; however this has not been confirmed.

name: Multiple Browser Remote Denial Of Service Vulnerability
description: There exists a denial of service vulnerability in Mozilla Firefox, Opera and Microsoft Internet Explorer. Attackers can exploit this issue by enticing the user to visit a malicious web page.

name: Trend Micro InterScan Web Security Virtual Appliance Multiple Vulnerabilities
description: Trend Micro InterScan Web Security Virtual Appliance is prone to vulnerabilities that can allow an attacker to upload or download files to or from the Trend Micro InterScan Web Security Virtual Appliance.

name: Trend Micro InterScan Web Security Virtual Appliance Cross Site Request Forgery Vulnerability
description: The Trend Micro InterScan Web Security Virtual Appliance is vulnerable to cross-site request forgery attacks.  If leveraged, these cross-site request forgery attacks can allow an attacker to gain unauthorized access or perform some administrative actions.

name: Microsoft Internet Information Services 5 Authentication Bypass Vulnerability
description: There is a vulnerability in IIS5. This vulnerability  is because of using Alternate Data Stream to open a protected  folder.

name: Apache Tomcat 'RequestDispatcher' Information Disclosure Vulnerability
description: Apache Tomcat, when a RequestDispatcher is used, performs path normalization before removing the query string from the URI, which allows remote attackers to conduct directory traversal attacks and read arbitrary files via a .. (dot dot) in a request parameter.

name: CUPS Web Interface Information Disclosure Vulnerability
description: The cgi_initialize_string function in cgi-bin/var.c in the web interface in CUPS, does not properly handle parameter values containing a % (percent) character without two subsequent hex characters, which allows context-dependent attackers to obtain sensitive information from cupsd process memory via a crafted request, as demonstated by the (1) /admin?OP=redirect&URL=% and (2) /admin?URL=/admin/&OP=% URIs.

name: Access ActiveX Control Vulnerability
description: A remote code execution vulnerability exists in Access ActiveX controls due to the way that multiple ActiveX controls are loaded by Internet Explorer. An attacker who successfully exploited this vulnerability could run arbitrary code as the logged-on user. If a user is logged on with administrative user rights, an attacker could take complete control of the affected system.

name: Microsoft MFC Library 'UpdateFrameTitleForDocument()' Buffer Overflow Vulnerability
description: The Microsoft Windows MFC library is prone to a buffer-overflow vulnerability because it fails to perform adequate boundary checks of user-supplied input. Successfully exploiting this issue may allow attackers to execute arbitrary code in the context of applications that use the vulnerable method. Failed exploit attempts will likely result in a denial-of-service condition.

name: Sun Java Web Sever 7.0 u7 Admin Interface DOS
description: There is a vulnerability in sun java web server. Attackers can exploit this issue by sending malicious requests.

name: Apple Webkit SVG RadialGradiant Run-in Remote Code Execution
description:
Use-after-free vulnerability in WebKit in Apple Safari allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code or cause a denial of service (application crash) via vectors related to the Cascading Style Sheets (CSS) run-in property and multiple invocations of a destructor for a child element that has been referenced multiple times.

Note: This vulnerability was shared with Trend Micro in advance of public disclosure by TippingPoint through its Zero Day Initiative (http://www.zerodayinitiative.com).

name: Opera Remote Denial Of Service Vulnerability
description: There exists a denial of service vulnerability in Opera. Attackers can exploit this issue by enticing the user to visit a malicious web page.

name: Apple Safari Webkit Attribute Child Removal Code Execution
description: Use-after-free vulnerability in WebKit in Apple Safari allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code or cause a denial of service (application crash), or read the SMS database or other data, via vectors related to "attribute manipulation".

name: Novell iManager Schema Create Class Stack Buffer Overflow Remote Vulnerability
description:
Novell iManager is prone to a stack-based buffer-overflow vulnerability because it fails to perform adequate boundary checks on user-supplied data.
Attackers may exploit this issue to execute arbitrary code with SYSTEM-level privileges. Successful exploits will completely compromise affected computers. Failed exploit attempts will result in a denial-of-service condition.

name: VMware SpringSource Spring Framework class.classloader Remote Code Execution
description: SpringSource Spring Framework allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code via an HTTP request containing class.classLoader.URLs[0]=jar: followed by a URL of a crafted .jar file.

name: SapGUI BI Heap Corruption Exploit
description: There is a vulnerability in SapGUI. Attackers can exploit this issue by enticing user to visit malicious web pages.

name: CA XOsoft Multiple Products xosoapapi.asmx Buffer Overflow
description: Multiple buffer overflows in CA XOsoft allow remote attackers to execute arbitrary code via (1) a malformed request to the ws_man/xosoapapi.asmx SOAP endpoint or (2) a long string to the entry_point.aspx service.

name: Adobe Shockwave Memory Corruption Remote Code Execution
description: Adobe Shockwave Player is prone to a remote code execution vulnerability while attempting to load a specially crafted Adobe Director File allowing remote attackers to execute arbitrary code on vulnerable installations.

name: Adobe Shockwave Remote Denial Of Service
description: There is a vulnerability in Adobe Shockwave. Attackers can exploit this issue by sending crafted malicious files.

name: Novell GroupWise Internet Agent 'CREATE' Verb Stack Buffer Overflow
description: Novell GroupWise Internet Agent is prone to a stack-based buffer-overflow vulnerability because it fails to perform adequate boundary checks on user-supplied data. Attackers may exploit this issue to execute arbitrary code with SYSTEM-level privileges. Successful exploits will completely compromise affected computers. Failed exploit attempts will result in a denial-of-service condition.

name: Mozilla Firefox nsTreeSelection Dangling Pointer Remote Code Execution Vulnerability
description: This vulnerability allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code on vulnerable installations of Mozilla Firefox. User interaction is required to exploit this vulnerability in that the target must visit a malicious page or open a malicious file.

name: Identified Suspicious Microsoft Excel Document
description: This filter is to detect malicious Microsoft Excel Document.

name: Multiple Browser Status Bar Obfuscation And Clickjacking Vulnerability
description: Multiple browsers are vulnerable to Java Obfuscation and Clickjacking vulnerability which leads to malicious website by a mouse on OnClick action.

name: Apple Safari Personal Address Book AutoFill Information Disclosure Weakness
description: Apple Safari is prone to an information-disclosure weakness. A remote attacker can exploit this issue to obtain sensitive information that may aid in further attacks.

name: Identified Suspicious Microsoft Write Document
description: This filter is to detect malicious Microsoft Write Documents.

name: IBM BladeCenter Management Module Multiple Security Vulnerabilities
description: There are multiple vulnerabilities in IBM BladeCenter. Attackers can exploit this issue by sending malicious requests.

name: Mozilla Firefox Multiple Denial Of Service
description: There is a vulnerability in Mozilla Firefox. Attackers can exploit this issue by enticing user to visit malicious web page.

name: Mozilla Firefox Location Bar Spoofing Remote Vulnerability
description: The startDocumentLoad function in browser/base/content/browser.js in Mozilla Firefox does not properly implement the Same Origin Policy in certain circumstances related to the about:blank document and a document that is currently loading, which allows (1) remote web servers to conduct spoofing attacks via vectors involving a 204 (aka No Content) status code, and allows (2) remote attackers to conduct spoofing attacks via vectors involving a window.stop call.

name: Microsoft Internet Explorer Frame Border Property Denial Of Service
description: Microsoft Internet Explorer is prone to a denial-of-service vulnerability because it fails to properly validate user-supplied input.Successfully exploiting this issue can cause the browser to crash, resulting in a denial-of-service condition.

name: Quiksoft EasyMail 'AddAttachment()' Method ActiveX Control Buffer Overflow Vulnerability
description: Quiksoft EasyMail is prone to an unspecified buffer-overflow vulnerability because the application fails to perform adequate boundary checks on user-supplied data. Successful exploits allow remote attackers to execute arbitrary code in the context of the application using the ActiveX control (typically Internet Explorer). Failed exploit attempts will likely result in denial-of-service conditions.

name: Apple Safari Stack Overflow Denial Of Service
description: The cfnetwork.dll for the Windows version of Apple's Safari browser is vulnerable to a buffer overflow attack.  This buffer overflow can cause the Safari browser to crash, and under certain conditions, crash without generating an error message.

name: Ipswitch IMail Server List Mailer 'imailsrv.exe' Buffer Overflow Vulnerability
description: Ipswitch IMail Server is prone to a buffer-overflow vulnerability because it fails to perform adequate boundary checks on user-supplied data. Attackers may exploit this issue to execute arbitrary code with SYSTEM-level privileges. Successful exploits will completely compromise affected computers. Failed exploit attempts will result in a denial-of-service condition.

name: Apple Webkit CSS Charset Text Transformation Remote Code Execution Vulnerability
description:
WebKit in Apple Safari and Google Chrome does not properly handle a transformation of a text node that has the IBM1147 character set, which allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code or cause a denial of service via a crafted HTML document containing a BR element, related to a 'type checking issue'.

Note: This vulnerability was shared with Trend Micro in advance of public disclosure by TippingPoint through its Zero Day Initiative.
(http://www.zerodayinitiative.com)

name: Mozilla Firefox Multiple Memory Corruption Vulnerabilities
description: Mozilla Firefox is prone to multiple remote memory-corruption vulnerabilities. Successful exploits may allow an attacker to execute arbitrary code in the context of the user running the affected application. Failed exploit attempts will result in a denial-of-service condition.

name: Symantec Antivirus Corporate Ed. Alert Management Service Remote Privilege Escalation Vulnerability
description: Symantec Antivirus Corporate Edition is prone to a remote privilege-escalation vulnerability. This issue affects the Alert Management Service. Attackers can exploit this issue to gain SYSTEM-level privileges on an affected computer.

name: Apple Quicktime Remote Code Execution Vulnerability
description: Apple QuickTime Player allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code via movie files which may trigger to download malware from malicious websites.

name: Mozilla Firefox Cross-origin Data Leakage Vulnerability
description: Use of the window.onerror error handler can be used to read a destination URL, which can allow for information regarding other sessions to be disclosed.

name: Mozilla Firefox Plugin Parameter Array Dangling Pointer
description: Mozilla Firefox is prone to a remote code-execution vulnerability. An attacker can exploit this issue to execute arbitrary code in the context of the user running the affected application. Failed exploit attempts will likely result in denial-of-service conditions.

name: Windows Live MSN ActiveX Remote Code Execution
description: Windows Live MSN ActiveX control is prone to a vulnerability that lets attackers overwrite files with arbitrary, attacker-controlled content. Successfully exploiting this issue will allow an attacker to execute arbitrary code on the victim's computer in the context of the vulnerable application using the ActiveX control.

name: Microsoft Soap SDK mssoap1.dll ActiveX Remote Code Execution
description: Microsoft Soap SDK mssoap1.dll ActiveX control is prone to a vulnerability that lets attackers overwrite files with arbitrary, attacker-controlled content. Successfully exploiting this issue will allow an attacker to execute arbitrary code on the victim's computer in the context of the vulnerable application using the ActiveX control.

name: Novell iPrint Client Remote File Deletion
description: Novell iPrint Client can be exploited by malicious people to manipulate certain data or compromise a user's system. A logic error in nipplib.dll when removing files can be exploited via the "CleanupUploadFiles()" method provided by the ActiveX control to recursively delete files on a user's system.

name: MS IE Uninitialized Memory Corruption
